aV52-k8EvnVm3FYgLae0Ww.text: Very cute place. The sandwiches were fresh and tasty. We tried the rossamanna, most Americans won't think of it as dessert, as the sugar amount is same as breakfast cereal. I got coleslaw as a side and it was, too, fresh and not too sweet.

axSdAB7uiZMvkQCl2kXxAQ.text: Everyone here was extremely friendly and the atmosphere alone made it a great place to visit. The food was amazing as well. We got a smorgasbord of curried rice, pancakes with the compote, and an omelette and potatoes and every single bite was eaten. It is just a great place overall and you should come visit it and help this new business flourish.

YZVVdf6a0Aeu-E6fM3wEtQ.text: Tried this little gem because of all the great reviews we had read on yelp and, WOW, did it live up to its rating!!! From the moment we walked in and, was greeted til the time we left everything was completely 1st rate! My daughter had the waffle with strawberry compote and, the waffle was perfectly crunchy on the outside but, soft on the inside. The compote was sweet with a hint lemon so, it wasn't too sweet. My wife created her own omelet that included cheddar, roasted red pepper and sausage with a side of their wonderful greenchile sauce(we spent 16 years in New Mexico and, feel we know how a good GC sauce should taste). I had their house made cornbeef hash with eggs and a side of their homemade potatoes. A lot of times when I've ordered a house made cbhash it usually comes out as just the cured shredded beef but, at Alo they cure the beef then create a True hash by mincing the beef with potatoes and seasonings. OMG, it was one of the best hashes I've ever tasted. My eggs were perfectly cooked and the potatoes were nicely seasoned then pan fried bites of yummy goodness!!! We live in Oregon but, if I were a Phoenician I would be dining at the Alo at least once a week!!! The service was outstanding with our server explaining the cafe is influenced by Estonian flavors so, he explained some of the dishes on the menu then, pointed out some of his personal favs.

uiH0ilxufY6mk7evDrTWyg.text: Great little cafe. Loved the setting and food! A nice variety of breakfast options.. Pesto omelette was awesome

KEmzAY18qfBgz53SJxNmfQ.text: When you are tired of the trendy breakfast places in Old Town that serve the same watered down breakfast fare, go to this hidden gem right off Scottsdale. The food is excellent with matching personable service and friendly owners. The coffee is very good and their inventive omelettes are superb. They also offer Estonian desserts which is a rarity in Arizona.

sxcVydDAysLhQX62eScirA.text: Wow!  Just ate breakfast here for the first time and it was so healthy and delicious.  I had a Mediterranean omelet and my husband had the Chicago.  The ingredients were so fresh and tasty and the outdoor patio was cute.  I would definitely recommend breakfast topped off with one of their specialty coffees!

xx_3FJlGDLSNwdFug7T1GA.text: Great place grab a bite to eat and get some homework done without the hussle and bustle of a coffee shop!

hlFRhtqKmp4aV6HxyucLeg.text: Great time with good friends, enhanced by tasty eats and friendly service. Try the chocolate walnut pie-75 year old family recipe -yummy!

AHHtfmjWxJRJVRiObLe5YQ.text: Friendly staff, unique and fresh food, good prices. A few of my favorite menu items are the Jamaican Curried Rice, the house cured Corned Beef, and the Huevos de Madrid. They also have amazing teas from Wisdom Nectar, my favorite is Flower Power!

AouKJYgUMJ0CZxH-HkRvlw.text: Excellent service and great atmosphere. Wide variety of breakfast choices. Nice patio seating area, perfect fit enjoying the fresh morning air.

X1LFVJ3l0_KzTdMkPbYBSA.text: alo cafe' is tucked at 1st and goldwater blvd. next to a very charming gift shop-named jam.  the cartel drip coffee is the best i've ever tasted. the smoothie was great with real fruit and your choice of milk-cow's, half+half, soy, almond or coconut.   i chose almond+coconut!  it was great.    my mom and her friend enjoyed the "jamaican rice made with real butter + spices etc. mom chose to add "balsamic" chicken + ordered vernors ginger ale.  her friend chose the spicier "jerk" chicken+diet vernors.  i tasted - of course!  it was great even without the 12+hot sauces they offer!   regular offerings include: monte cristo sandwiches, grilled cheeese! specials of that day included: "open-faced" waffle with syrup+raspberry+blueberry jam, meat was offered although i don't remember which kind.  inside was chilled to perfection!  we sat out in the sun-umbrella +shaded tables were available.  young lady cashier answered all 100 ???'s non-flustered+chef was very nice as well!!!  all around winner!  hope they have the estonian pudding desert available on my next visit!  handicapped parking (2), tiny lot + street parking!

HN9peVQWwQR_O34skukdug.text: Literally the best breakfast I've ever had. If you come to Scottsdale and don't dine here you're missing the boat.

Q0S5DFtnmUlLADdNiEDoVg.text: Went back this weekend and again had a great experience. The waitresses were attending, but not overly present. We had chicken curry with rice and chicken curry in a croissant. Both were delicious, and plenty to fill your tummy.

DqYBEFDGBYuuzcuDvtbx8w.text: So I came to Alo Cafe this morning for a birthday breakfast--first time customers. We were politely warned upon arrival that the wait time after ordering would be about 30 minutes due to them having a small kitchen, which was fine with us. We had seen the reviews and were thrilled to try the food! We got seated immediately and were given waters and menus, and then were left alone for 30 minutes before we unfortunately decided to get up and go eat somewhere else. We saw lots of staff walking around and serving other tables--as a matter of fact, there was an employee wearing the Alo Cafe shirt chatting with the table next to us for at least 15 minutes. The food might be worth it, and I will probably never find that out for myself. Just wanted to share my birthday breakfast disappointment.

xHXsoQVdKVq0fIoA2bZeXw.text: Great hidden gem tucked away in Scottsdale. I had the Yucatan omelette and it was amazing. My food was hot, just the right serving and I had excellent service. I'll definitely be returning.

MUvQoOq6ioaD5OCcWnyjoQ.text: Great place. Staff was sweet and the New Yorker owner is entertaining. Food was clearly fresh and house made. Try the omelet with lox and the lavender gray tea.

U8oCnIuq9BrHt4kbiXNQqg.text: We decided to go to this place because of the Yelp reviews, proximity to the hotel and the fact that we were starving.  We made a great decision!  This is a mom n pop restaurant so it's obviously on a smaller scale but it had good ambiance and even better food... Service was stellar.  There's really no complaints as even my child who's a very picky eater and is now into pancakes was disappointed that they didn't have them. He went for the waffles thinking he was going to be disappointed: he wasn't! There's only other place that he would eat waffles in Oregon and so for him to have the biggest smile after the first bite was a sight to see...  We really enjoyed our meals, felt the freshness in every bite and especially going to another restaurant that claimed to have fresh marketplace food and got served cold tasteless eggs this seems like a go-to place for fresh food and supporting the small business.  Con: not enough parking but if you get here early it shouldn't be a problem and it's oh so WORTH it!

mpJTelyIZVxiVM5XaaUYyw.text: It's 84 degrees and gently overcast on a Sunday morning. I am seated at a small cafe table on the patio at Alo Cafe. A slight breeze blows through green leaves of bushes and the tree beside me. This is my very first time here.  When I arrived around 10:00a, the patio was already full, so I found a seat inside. I was immediately greeted by a very busy, though cheerful, Alicia. She informed me that a seat outside would likely be a 10 minute wait and apologized for the inconvenience.  I was not in any hurry, so made myself comfortable and ordered a pour-over coffee. A few minutes later, the coffee was served and I placed an order for the breakfast sandwich with sausage and cheddar cheese.  Around 10:35, Alicia let me know that a couple of tables had opened up outside, so I decided to migrate. I found a spot in the back corner of the patio under a small tree. It felt like a miniature getaway all my own.  Nick came by to check up on me and offered to refill my coffee. I gladly accepted. Both he and Alicia were very attentive and polite throughout the course of my visit. Eventually, my sandwich made it's way out to me. I had been waiting for some time, but didn't mind in the least.  Still, Alicia apologized for the long wait, explaining that it was due to a large group take-out order and informing me that my coffee was on the house as an apology. The sandwich wasn't amazing, but I loved that they used real egg. Felt very homemade.  I ordered a mango/ginger scone "for dessert" and received another coffee refill. Both the coffee and the scone were delicious. The check came with a "No rush - stay as long as you like." And I did. Just me and the bushes and my tree and the singing birds.  Do I absolutely love this place and the people I got to meet here? Yes, so much. Would I recommend Alo Cafe? Without a moment's hesitation. If you haven't been, I can't recommend it highly enough.  Sit inside if you want the noisy bustle of a village cafe. Sit outside to disappear into a quieter, garden-like retreat. If you're super lucky, you'll get the same great attention from the same great team of servers that I did.  Alicia and Nick - thank you both for being so wonderful. Alo Cafe - thank YOU for being the hidden gem that you are. I'll be sure to visit again, and I'll be sure to send others your way every chance I get.  :)

djSIXs2i6VXTlCvm-m9wqw.text: This cute little breakfast/lunch and coffee place is tucked right behind the cornish pasty co. Plenty of parking, and a very quaint spot to grab a coffee or sit down and order a meal. Their outside seating has sprinklers, and inside has a few tables. Great coffees, fresh omelets, and delicious waffles! I always go for the build your own omelet, and dip the side potatoes in their house curry sauce- definitely a nice switch up from my usual ketchup obsession. Another perk is their patio is puppy friendly! I will be back!

CmwB_2VrIRVw0zRklBQ4Bg.text: I visited this place for the first time this past weekend and I must say I was beyond pleased. The Chi-Towne omelette is the best omelette I've had in my life!!! It had such unique ingredients and flavors! I am not kidding you when I say that every single bite of it was more and more amazing! When I was close to finishing it I was kind of sad actually. The chef also brought out this specialty sauce with ketchup and other delicious ingredients it had a spice to it. I love that this cozy cafe has an outdoor area because I really enjoy outdoor brunches. The waitress was attentive and made sure we didn't need anything throughout our meal. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to try unique spices and homemade custom specialty menu options.

Highly recommend.   **Update** I've been here at least 10 times and I really love the food, but the service is not good. Every time they blame it on servers not showing, but at what point do you not get new servers!   Food is easily 5 stars, but the service needs improvement.

qC6OoVs50D8iiAcjD2GoLQ.text: This was our second visit to Alo Cafe and the food was as good as we remembered. You can be comfortable sitting inside or out at this quaint bistro. The food is fresh and the bakery items are amazing. We shared a chocolate chip scone served with softened butter and it heavenly; crisp on the outside warm ans moist on the inside. My husband had the Mediterranean Omelet which he really enjoyed and I had a build your own omelet with spinach, mushrooms and cheddar, very tasty with just the right balance of ingredients. Oven roasted potatoes come as a side and they were good. My Mom had the Belgium waffle with a generous helping of whip cream and strawberries and she loved it. We all shared the french press coffee which always prefer and it was very good; hot strong and not bitter.

Ir0AMOshLazu5K4XbQxrMA.text: Went here for lunch and was bummed that we didn't love it as much as other yelpers.  Love that you can have your dog with you while you eat outside on their patio area.  But the patio area is not the best...not the worst but not the best.  Service was friendly but slow.  Food was pretty good, coffee not so much.  It wasn't "bad", but compared to the many other places we've found thru Yelp, this one is kind of a disappointment.  Alo is not some place we would bring out of town guests to.

asPZAPO7xaXN5QgZnHP4fA.text: With the reviews and photos we saw on Yelp we were excited to eat here for breakfast.  When we arrived the setting looked promising.  Eclectic look and hipster feel.  When we walked inside we were met with only slightly cooler air than the outside.  Maybe the A/C was broken.  Service was pleasant but sparse.  One girl running around for everyone.    We ordered and were advised that the breakfast potatoes were not ready.  We said we would be happy to wait for them to be done.  Our drinks were awful.  The water had a garden-hose or bad tap water taste and the iced black tea tasted fermented.  We exchanged the tea for Lemonade and it was fine.  Our omelette arrived overcooked - the eggs had brown spots on it.  Either the grill was too hot or they were cooked too long.  Ingredients were fresh though so that was a plus.  Potatoes were Rosemary oven roasted.  Flavor was alright but nothing special and they still weren't cooked through.    For the price, we expected more flavor or service or better tasting food.   The one good thing about the place was the large assortment of unique hot sauce and condiments.    Overall - left no longer hungry but was unsatisfied.

9FTgBUElg8txr0cZUsOVXQ.text: Very nice! We came on a Sunday morning, luckily it wasn't super crowed , call ahead & check before you coming because this place is pretty small room inside or out on the patio . The food was awesome , def coming back . Nice view & very  quiet relaxing.

7JGojzTvFdQbSiw5iGuQng.text: 5 stars is not enough for breakfast at Alo. I had the home made pastrami with eggs over easy it was amazing.  Mom had the hatch chilli omelet which had cream cheese and fresh pico. Jason our server was friendly and made is feel at home.  They also have around 30 hot sauces you can choose from. Would highly recommend

1FIx7xjsNthjLngpD9X06g.text: This is what sane people want when they decide to get brunch.  No loud rave music, attentive staff, and excellent food.  I had the best omelet I have had in 45 years on this planet. HONEY HERB BRAMLET. THAT IS LITERALLY THE ONLY THING YOU NEED TO KNOW. It had brie, honey ham, and some delightful blend of herbs and it was just perfect.  If I was alone I probably would have ordered three more and shame eaten them in my hotel just because the flavor was so spot on.  I ordered the south African sausage because I had never heard of it, and it was unsurprisingly awesome as well.

5WjhkI-dezPe5XjCPXE5Vg.text: So searching for something new and different that opened no later than 7 I plugged in the zip code and "breakfast" and this was one of the options. I had already decided to go there and several folks at brunch on Saturday confirmed I needed to try it out. We got there early and were invited to grab a seat on the patio and relax while they finished getting ready. I would say 2/3 of the seating is outside so I am sure it could be too hot or too cold parts of the year. The tables are pretty much squeezed in wherever. Spring time just after sunrise was perfect on the patio. I had the corned beef hash which is brined in house and was delicious. R had the Monte Cristo with a side of potatoes/onions and raved about it. Shortly after opening the owner came in with his puppy and had his morning cup of coffee and chatted with the customers. There is also a cat who seems to own the courtyard but stayed away from people. The owner mentioned that being Scottsdale things did not get crowded until 8-9. So: food great, atmosphere great, service great. I hope I get a chance to go back again.

flhUCTOh-cEX4IB0AOzNTw.text: Here on business. Found this restaurant on Yelp. Fantastic spot. Small, quaint...perfect for many occasions.  Vegetarian omelette was excellent. Also got Arnold Palmer.

COXjXCvG45rB5EUmwkFWhg.text: This place really is a hidden gem. The patio is adorable and the staff is always smiling and down to earth. The food is great & espresso is very smooth.  This is a great study spot for me w a very chill/mellow ambiance. I will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

z-Y4k8iVb82Tj1xz83JTxA.text: So excited I found this little gem!! It looks like a former house turned into a restaurant. Inside is very small, so if you don't like getting cozy this place might not be for you!  they do have seating outside as well, I saw someone with their pup sitting out there when I came. Looking at all the pics I already knew I had to try the waffle cristo!! Ordered that and it was SO GOOD. Serving size was more than enough and I just came in after running a few miles so I was definitely ready to get my grub on!! Hubby got the pastrami burrito and that was just as incredible! Mom got a fried egg sandwich and it came on its own so I would suggest ordering a side with that one! Coffee was a little overpriced in my opinion, a little over 3 bucks. They also have pastries though! Ordered the candied almond scone and it was pretty good! I really wanted to give 5 stars because of how phenomenal the food was but we had to wait forever to get our food and then it took forever to get our bill when we were ready to go. Someone that looked like possibly was the owner was just standing in the corner watching everyone as the only 2 servers were frantically running around trying to get everything done, not a great leader in my opinion. Other than that the servers were super nice! I will definitely still return the next time I want a great breakfast!

12ZlHyQTXpho8ZGMJTGmIQ.text: Cute little place. Not much seating. Located behind Cornish Pasty Co. Met a couple of friends for lunch. I had the Cuban. It was a decent sandwich. Our server was very nice. I would go back.

b2TUF4aOGuTwlDOMrYWuZg.text: The food was good. This place is tucked in behind the new Cornish Pasty and a little gem. I had the two eggs with potatoes and toast. I added in a side of bacon. Everything was hot and made to perfection. The only complaint that I had was that the coffee was very acidic and reminded me of old diner coffee. My buddy had the french toast and while the bread was a bit bland the fresh compote was excellent. It's a nice little gem and I hope more people find it so they can stay busy.   I didn't eat any baked goods but the key lime pie looked amazing.

sVMw3dygXcqXEom6rg0B-w.text: I stopped here for breakfast, and thoroughly enjoyed the Waffle Cristo. It wasn't a combination I would have thought of, but I was so glad I ordered it! The contrast of sweet and savory was to die for. It was set off nicely by their delicious iced coffee, which has a slight richness to it that I love. It makes me slow down a bit just to savor it.

yJ810wS7TIKDanCGldMeXA.text: Yum!!  Delicious and such a cozy atmosphere. We sat outside in perfect weather.  The menu had a lot of choices that sounded so good.  Was hard to narrow it down.  My friend and I were not disappointed.   We'll be back next time we're in the area.

wA4jh2ctE5Y2rNCBpbucrw.text: First of all let me start by saying I have never posted a review online. The fact that I am taking time out of my day to write this review shows how disappointed I was with this place.  First of all I want to address the time issue. I went there on my lunch break, big mistake. The food took forever and I had to ask for a to go box before I  even got my food. Perhaps this is because there was only one server, and one cook. My next issue is the food. I ordered the Monte Cristo Waffle and was very disappointed, flavor was band, nothing special. I picked at it a bit as I was on my lunch break and hungry, but ended up not eating it. I walked out of there, paying for a meal that took too long, and that I didnt eat because the flavor was just not there for me. This placed looked promising online, the atmosphere is very relaxing, sadly the service and food just werent there.

YiW0WkT8giCDbwuhLjphqw.text: A comfortable small cozy coffee house hidden in Scottsdale. Good service and decent breakfast. A nice relaxing space to chill.

x5bGe2r8aqHR8KnV2LNHLg.text: I was both surprised and impressed with Alo when a coworker suggested we try lunch there yesterday. The place is small and discreet, and despite living two streets away, I wasn't even aware it existed until we spotted it walking to Cornish Pasty. The menu was rather limited, but the Sedona chicken sandwich was unbelievable! It looked like it should be pictured on a menu and tasted even better!!! They let me swap fruit in for chips, and it was the perfect lunch meal. The setting is great, with lots of plants and flowers surrounding their shady patio. The service was a little hands-off, but very kind and helpful. I can't wait to go back and try something new! I wish they offered a few salads, but seriously, I would be happy again any day with that sandwich! Fresh, delicious and an awesome discovery!

W4Mc16s4Q6tUau1I8hPZAg.text: I found Alo Cafe through yelp. It is a cute little cafe with great outdoor seating off of the main road. You feel cocooned. The food was good and they served a great latte. If you're looking for a some quiet this may be the place for you!

Uya9SLI7Ujaf4l4tkOcD6w.text: Small little place. Excellent food! I had their daily special and it was fantastic! Friendly staff!

u0NvGotc1YEbLD_NxnYCxA.text: Great service. The corned beef hash is on fire. Went with a group of 9 people we All highly recommend this quaint, unassuming spot.

o5_O0VAA3haJ4-DEGh1Awg.text: Great little spot! Small and charming with great food and service. I had the Monte Cristo sandwich and my husband had the Mediterranean omelette. They were both very good. This was our first visit and we'll definitely be back.

kso3Ie3KaW2GDWAkOjMmjw.text: Fast friendly service great tasting food I'm not a fan of French toast but my daughter ordered and insisted I try it oh my it was amazing And you need to splurge and have it topped with fruit so good this place is kind of tucked away but worth the search

6D2cFkY8hRRyrjm6JeaxYA.text: Wow- a hidden gem- literally.. it's hiding behind Cornish Pasty in Old Town, but it's more than worth finding! If it's not too hot, park yourself out on the patio- it's a small place, but the service and food are largely worth it. I ordered the Yucatan Omelet- shrimp, zucchini and a chipotle cream sauce.. doing it over, I'd definitely do it again. Greg had the Chi omelet- it has a special sausage with cream cheese and a green chile sauce. Truly unique, but every ingredient made sense and added to the dish. We also ordered a side of the ghost hot salsa... wow, the flavor is fire in more ways than 1!  Go get it..

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yucatán omelet- $11.50 shrimp, zucchini and a chipotle cream sauce
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chi omelet with breakfast potatoes

kvnQLSCUjeSqraWfIuAT8g.text: Cute lil breakfast cafe. Tasty food but overpriced! 4 dollars for toast. 3.50 for OJ not even fresh squeezed. Excellent service however.

tH3g5Li1b06yLrXt06amJA.text: Came here on a Monday morning at 1115am, no one took our order until 30 mins later. Keep in mind there were maybe four other tables in this restaurant, so it wasn't busy at all. Waited and waited and waited, it's now 1205p and a table that literally sat down not too long ago, places their order way after us, got their food.   We have yet got our food as I type this review.

84lb8BPtt1G1uJPLg9BsTw.text: Nice little breakfast joint (seems family run) close by to Valley Ho hotel.  Good selection of hot sauces.  I had the hatch green chili omelette (fell in live with hatch green chilis while in new mexico)...only advice....add more green chili's...not that much.  Huge tortillas which i like with omelettes...i get to break off pieces and make little breakfast burritos with every bite.  I'd come back.

iNiCSLLjRB2P4ZyS1zyD6g.text: I don't know our waitresses name but she was sooo sweet(blonde hair and thin) and I had an amazing little breakfast with my boyfriend and his mom from out of town! Will definitely come back for a relaxing and yummy breakfast with hot coffee! Thank you so much!

Lc3f0d0zZ3d_fAdxxXzDBg.text: I wanted a carb breakfast; ordered their signature French toast. I don't think anyone likes soggy French toast & this didn't disappoint. A Corn Flake crust on one side kept the dish crunchy to the last bite. I recommend ordering a side of the "real maple syrup" - even though there's a $2 up-charge (no one should eat French toast with anything other than real maple syrup.). I ordered a house-made sausage patty & enjoyed it so much, I ordered an additional patty. Interestingly, the flavor was a bit different with the 2nd patty - which isn't uncommon with the subtleties of house-made sausages.   The waitstaff is attentive & very nice. There's indoor & outdoor sitting. The food is cooked to order & they ask you to tell them right up front if you have time constraints.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shot of menu with French toast, Belgian waffles, etc. offerings.
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shot of menu with their omelet selection.
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo Signature Corn Flake Crusted French Toast.

-GFBsSL3gIAERrvRUb9Ydw.text: Before heading home, the Mr and I were looking for a new breakfast spot and found Alo.  We really enjoyed sitting on the patio with our morning coffee while waiting for our breakfast.  Unfortunately, the coffee drinks weren't as good as the patio but we were hoping the breakfast would make up for it.  I ordered the Tortilla Espanola.  It had decent flavor but was a bit bland.  The hubby ordered the Breakfast Burrito and loved it.  He said it was probably the best breakfast burrito he'd ever had.  Overall, we had an above average experience and will definitely return...maybe for some lunch next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast Burrito
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla Espanola
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Another great patio experience in Scottsadale

_oKn7AwmS--9FsLsRt5wQg.text: Great little spot for breakfast or lunch. Homemade everything including the fresh mozzarella, pesto and pastrami.   Loved the pesto omelette with egg whites. The build-your-own omelette was great too. Don't miss the tray of dozens of hot sauces.

DSuOnz941JYXSjGY6dBg_A.text: Delicious brunch, coffee and service! I had the waffle topped with strawberries and whipped cream, my hubby had the tortilla espanola. We were both very happy with the food. The restaurant is also walking distance from Main Street, so we were able to walk around after the meal. I definitely recommend this place!

07xnkIJ3Z-J9xISrYUpXXA.text: This was a great little find. I love their tea and pastry selection and everything was great! I went here on a Monday morning at 8am and it was definitely very slow.   The omelet was great and my friends breakfast sandwich was great. I deeply appreciate the fact that their fruit was fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Omelet, sourdough toast, and fruit
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich and fresh fruit

R66h8vMlvUq02xIeg5qDvQ.text: Belgium waffle w strawberries and whip cream  Best we have had away from Bruge  The hash browns were the best I can recall  Service is slow so relax and enjoy

h1XrinGpg6wNMNQc4IiwTQ.text: It's to bad all the poor reviews about this place are True because I really wanted to find one of those great little hidden gyms. We can start with ordering iced tea and being served a $3 glass of murky stale Lipton. Then we are served our waffle that was $8 for one waffle with whipped cream and strawberries that my kids would either finish because it was soggy. I could have done a much better job and spent less If I just made this meal at home.

ZQUUrn_E8jnLiO_dL5j-ow.text: A cute Euro-style cafe that serves fancy versions of American breakfasts. The food is flavorful and "fun." It has outside seating that is quiet and sunny. Service is a bit slow (which is strange since we went during a not-so-busy weekday).   I loved my Chi-town omelet, a yummy way to start the day. The omelet includes: spicy sausage, white cheese, and homemade green chili. The side potatoes provided the right mix of crunchy edges and soft insides. Overall, this breakfast was peppery/good!  My daughter ordered Alo's signature French toast. It is made with crunchy corn flakes on the toast's faces. This dish was also was well-made, but I don't think it quite lives up the hype (... my usually piggy daughter only ate half of the dish).  Overall, a nice trendy breakfast place that sits on the pricey end of the cost spectrum.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chi- town omelet. Love it!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Signature french toast

SAb7ejfBK-T97ZljqBQ1YA.text: We had an awesome server, delicious food (the menu here is delightful, unique and surprising), and the charming ambience is hard to beat. Definitely check it out if you are looking for a sunny morning cafe. They have south african roobios tea and rusks which made my day!

02fivgIQDzBvDs14jd47_Q.text: They play iHeartRadio Coffee House Radio . IHeartMakes everything taste better!  Alo is an amazing little gem in heart of Oldtown. Omelets are amazing with cream cheese and salsa.  Local coffee from Passport is the best we've had. We've eaten here 2x over last 3 days.  A must breakfast spot. Servers are super nice too.

rTZmgxxolUNSJRLecLzUFw.text: I would have taken a picture of what I ate, but I ate everything before I could even think of a picture.   1. Havana coffee Hot : liked it, but didn't taste enough condensed milk. However loved it regardless  2. Housemade curry ketchup -Omg to die for. Prob. Would buy some if I could!  3.Corn beef hash- it was very good and very different from the CB hash I've had in the past, given most restaurants just take it from a can. You can tell this is housemade and fresh.  4. Chi town heat omlette- super good, I could feel the heat rising from my tongue. The sausage was the best part.  5. Corn flake French toast - I only had a couple bites because I was super full. It was good..it was just like regular French toast, but breaded in corn flakes which gave it that CRUNCH, with a nice moist on the inside. I've been to quite a few breakfast places and I always order French toast ..so the way this was prepared in terms of moistness is one of the top.  6. Hash browns- this was yummy and paired with the housemade curry ketchup it was hella good!!!   The staff was very accomdating and the overall ambience had a nice homely feel. I hate restaurants that are too big and feel less personal, because I get that greasy feeling in my stomach.  I felt like I was eating in someone's kitchen, which is a beautiful feeling.

IPvlKMzpFyw9lupUbkarkQ.text: Good coffee, and great food! There is plenty of street parking and a nice patio. I always order the Hatch Chili Omelette, and my Husband always orders the Chi Town Heat omelette, but there are sweeter options like pastries and waffles, Monte Cristo, Etc.. servers are good and very nice. The kind of local spot you wish was in your neighborhood!

H2m2xIpUgbn-V5pGs4Wo4A.text: Nice place kinda cramped but the fun/friendly servers make up for it.  I ordered the spicy chi-town omelette with green chile over the eggs and potatoes.  Nice flavor!    This is not your quick in a rush breakfast place.  They're not the most organized but fresh food makes up for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RcEHUqjT1FT-c0UXHeCgoA.text: The food is quite good and the wait staff friendly. It's a small place, so seating is tight and limited (somewhere around 20-25 people could fit inside). I was there on 2-24-18.  Why only four stars? Table was quite wobbly - easy fix with either something placed under one of the supports or adjusting the feet - and the syrup isn't real maple syrup. A lot of places here in Arizona don't seem to use real maple syrup. There is an obvious viscosity difference and the entire taste/texture is different. I'll have to bring along my own maple syrup for any future visit here or elsewhere.  I'd return though, very good food - not greasy or fake tasting like some breakfasts I've had.

bLjT6f59GLhnXtJhUmj5Uw.text: As a restaurant owner in LA..I'm a big support of mom and pop style places which could be harder to run. The girl serving us got us seating quickly and took our order once we had decided. The iced coffee was on point and if you're a waffle kinda guy I would really recommend it. Overall, sweet people with good service, good quality food. Not expensive and filling. Will be back when in Arizona. Also love the vibe outside, if it's not too hot out.

aSL04pgsSxD4rLjB7RFXpw.text: I have to agree with Justin I. place is cute. i really like the tiny patio (dog friendly btw) and the cute little old house the place occupies, but it took a long time for our food...as in 15-20 minutes.  when Yelp did the Waffle weekly yelp, we booked it over. the belgian waffle reviews and photos were mouth watering. but it wasn't that busy, so we thought it would be faster.  i ordered the belgian waffle. we were asked if we wanted the fruit compote...which is a whopping 2.50 extra...and i thought "nah, that's way too much for fruit compote, and a tasty waffle should stand on it's own....with a little syrup". my waffle, although fine, was nothing spectacular. why it made the weekly Yelp, i don't know. waffle house waffles???? trashy, yes, but way better.  my wife ordered the french toast. hers was much tastier...some kind of sweet, corn flake style crust on the outside.  i'm sure some of the other items may hold better, but we have our fav's that we'll probably stick to instead.

XxS_gqXtAX5KIx7ZvqGHaA.text: Horrible. Waited over 40 mins for something i ordered right away when i got there! And gave me the wrong bread. Not to bitch too much, but sat & not too full, memorial day weekend...should be great service! And if u only have brown bread, tell someone when they order sourdough! I also asked for coffee. Never came. Ingredients for the omelet were low grade. Place is super tiny inside so i sat outside. Would never repeat this place!

55HWeXqwMemEN5iwqBychw.text: Waited 10 minutes just to put drink order in, should of stopped there & went somewhere else but we decided to order the French toast , pesto omelette & sausage egg sandwich. Waited at least 30 minutes for the food to come out. Coffee was well gone before receiving food. The French toast was dry & cold, I ate about 5 bites & tried to send it back. They offered the sandwich so I decided to try it, not impressed! I tried my husbands pesto omelette & it was actually good. I will not be going back to this place for the service & quality of food. Boo

GcHneErect9KnH9p0GkDKg.text: What a great little, nondescript place. The food was fresh. The service friendly, and the story behind the place intriguing.   Though not "glitzy and glam", the little restaurant felt very comfy and clean. Almost like sitting at the breakfast table at home, but without the cooking and cleanup.   If in the area, you MUST go here. You will not regret it.

e3kBcJJu5zlj1rS6mcduFQ.text: Super cute little cafe hidden in Scottsdale! They serve breakfast and lunch menu all day. Ordered beef hash with poached eggs on my first visit with an iced latte. It is so delicious that I am back for 2nd time! The service is great too as waiter/waitress are very friendly. They have outdoor seating as well.  Definitely a great place for breakfast/lunch. I will come back again!

4jwboGPaLAj3DjI3adGAYQ.text: The definition of a five star experience. The service was great and the food will bring me back again, had the Waffle Cristo which was fire and then the Pastrami Breakfast Burrito with Feta! Fire!

CTLfEUxtijnlRKjYyFcbWw.text: Great food and great atmosphere! Only con is the wait for food. As long as you go in there knowing you will wait a bit (worth the wait) you'll be satisfied.   Get the breakfast sandwich (sub the roll for a croissant) and you'll want to go back every day thereafter!

60AbeLCN2AMizg11v2iixw.text: The worst service is no service.  Waited over an hour. At the beginning we were told they were short staffed (totally understandable), had no ice (okay?), and we could seat wherever (cool). Sat outside, got poked by a trees. After half of the wait and NO attention, I moved inside, got a menu and sat while my group followed.  The owner comes up to me (FINALLY ATTENTION), but just to ask if I would be using all the seats...wft?? I told the owner my group and I were waiting outside for 30 mins with no service.  He just said okay, can back to wipe the table, then no service again.  The food in the pix looked great, the food and even water served to others looked great, but we honestly felt invisible.  Just the worst and we were all excited to try out the place.  Oh and at one point the owner came back from buying two bags of ice and blocked cars in the process.  Just walked out, and went to brat haus, got served in less than one min with ice in our waters.

-qPEWZJZwi2iFtIEZuedjQ.text: Went here once for their monte cristo! I loved the food and the staff was super friendly but the seating needs some work. Its a very small place and they also have patio seating however because they have such amazing food they are packed. We were forced to sit inside at some chairs that were not the best and not comfortable at all. They really need to get the seating taken care of to be 5 stars. Please fix so when we come back its better! Thanks!!! Your food is amazing!!!

RbAFe9vdhDDvQpurZZBfgQ.text: I was so excited to check this place out but boy was it a disappointment. Food was pretty good but the service was horrendous. Our drinks arrived half way through our meal along with the 1.50 side of hot sauce. For the Chicago Omelette and the Monte Cristo sandwich with a small side of fruit an ice tea, OJ, and coffee our bill was $40. For a $20 breakfast per person the food and service better both be on point. I definitely won't be returning to Alo anytime soon.

BZFFH_62_8apIvNfVRhp9w.text: We were so excited to have found this place on Yelp. It's such a cute location, the service was friendly, and the food was sooo good!! I had the breakfast burrito, and I have been thinking about it since. I can't wait to go back to try other things that look really good.

_KZGPjR9_9V-dDp1wwFxNQ.text: The Menu offers Spain & Mediterranean flavors!  Delicious, fresh and the owner has a story for each of this signature dishes!  Must try when your in town, this is our third time here and looking forward to returning when in town again!

UgNFDN59q4F8Ltspc8jvZw.text: The food was great, but absolutely the poorest service I've experienced in quite a while. For example, it took them 20 minutes just to get coffee to the table

rOqvxQwniLvZkBWHTMUlfA.text: What a great little find, with a story. Family owned, music lovers with Estonian heritage. Named after a musician who helped gain freedom for Estonia - breaking away from communism. Oh, and the food is delicious and the team helpful. AC inside, lovely outdoor patio ad well.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

O-cCuMcRS6Bvm-ub_gZ8vg.text: Pros: You're greeted & asked about seating. French toast was great.  Cons: Be sure to check your food, like a breakfast sandwich in which you asked for cheddar cheese & didn't get it. You have to tell them about the potatoes that came with your meal. Your server never comes to make sure you have everything. Oh, and the juice I was given was half a glass because they ran out but, charged for a full glass.

CHHrwziFOI1LJloaLAT-uw.text: The food and service was great. As you would expect given all the great reviews. The curry ketchup was a perfect match for the corned-beef has, and you have to get the fresh, real whipped cream with anything that goes with whipped cream. Oh so yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside:
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Their selection of bottled and canned drinks:
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kringle...A type of celebration cake from Estonia according the Alicia, the cheerful server at Alo.

CH9XjTmQAHeVEwd1QT8abQ.text: Alo cafe is by far one of my favorite breakfast spots. The food is amazing and made to order. You can tell it's top quality and super fresh. Love the patio and atmosphere. The staff is very friendly and nice. Would recommend Alo cafe to anyone that is looking for a great meal and nice atmosphere to meet up with friends and family.

ykYjVVDeu1s01PJZlHptZg.text: This is one of the most unquie breakfast cafes I've ever been to. It is a very relaxed cozy environment and the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable. I got to meet the owner and hear how he came up with his creative takes on the dishes from his travels from South Africa, Spain, and Europe. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back to try more and their desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corn beef hash. The owner makes the hash by having a full brisket in a brine for 10 days with carrots and some spices.
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Huevos de Madrid with a side of South African sausages.
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo café

DgR45qBHrEw_7JYHQPBEhA.text: My husband loved his croissant French toast, my waffle was over cooked but they were also short staffed the morning we went. Cute little place. Everything is a la cart, so don't be fooled by the $. The 2 of us spent $42 for breakfast.

ClrvStRaPoVSlZMYGO4iJg.text: I am late on my review of this place but, I loved it.  People are quick to review bad places or experiences but, if a place is good we tend to forget.  *Never forget every place can have off times or employees can be having a bad day.  So I try to always give the benefit of the doubt on any review.  I also have worked in many fields so I tend to know what is acceptable and what is not.  With all the being said I really liked this place and will add it into my breakfast rotation.  However, I tend to favor the small "hole in the wall" (I say that loosely because I mean more low key) places.   My Food was great! This was a very home cook flare with some, international flavors.  I love the choices, and it was hard to make a choice.  What I ordered was amazing!  I want to try more soon.   My Service was great! The waitress was very friendly, spent time answering all our questions and made sure that we liked her recommendations.  We asked am million questions and she was so patient with us but, we also came on off peak hours (no waitress can do that on ON peak hours).  She even brought out agave nectar with my Yerbamate tea I was trying, just in case I wanted it sweeter.  She was right on the money & I didn't have to find her.  As a past Hooter's waitress (you may not like the restaurant but we had great training policies), we were suppose to predict what a customer needed before they asked.  So it was great on her part :)    The Atmosphere was cozy! We sat outside because I am obsessed. It was comfortable and cozy.  It isn't a big place so it gives you that small town feel.  I love it!    The owner came out and talked with us! I love seeing this because you know that the owner really cares about his business and you can see his passion.

c4e25UfY-V5enAuNL2cbpw.text: Traveling from out of town, we ate here as our first breakfast spot in Scottsdale. The front of the menu warns the place requires some time to prepare food in the ktichen as it's small. They encourage you to order coffee or tea while you wait. We did. We didn't get it until we were halfway through our meal! The corned beef and hash, as my wife reported, was delicious. I ordered the special of the morning, the smoked pork with eggs. It was delicious but the accompanying potatoes were burned and the toast was nearly untoasted. When I wasn't looking at my beautiful wife, I was looking at the crap stacked a top the refrigerator. And wondering when they last cleaned the hot sauces stacked at the corner of the register which I had to get myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Junk lying around.

JcD4Fi6fdyoQutTcNllOzQ.text: It's a trap!  Ignored for 10 minutes, five more minutes for some good black coffee, and then paid $7 for an awfully uninspiring breakfast sandwich. Well, I'm waiting to pay for the sandwich because I am being ignored still. Enough flies on the patio to keep me entertained swatting them at least. Won't be back.

tk7k9I-NP3xfD133Kqel4Q.text: My husband and I attended a special evening event dinner last night. The main dish was paella which was authentic and delicious. Several courses of tapas preceded the dinner with each one being extraordinary with diverse and unique ingredients.  Absolutely scrumptious!

7NlI5mP0uXILvqcYYLFdsA.text: The food was very basic. I could make better. The service was slow but the waiters were nice. The place is falling apart and not advertised as it is on Yelp. I don't recommend coming here .

5MG31OSs9mT5M0ohSB2Ngw.text: I wanted an almond milk late and they were out of almond milk. So I had to get soy. Which is fine. I'll live. Then I ordered just eggs and bacon to go. My total was $10.82 for the coffee eggs and bacon. I got to work and they forgot the bacon. So now I just paid $10.82 for eggs and a small coffee. That's ridiculous. And the eggs were super super runny. Won't go back.

NWJXGzB29dpQkNiBRx7U0g.text: One of my FAVORITE cafes! The crew at Alo always has on a smile and accommodating! My family and I love coming on weekends for delicious breakfast. Everything is always delicious and quickly prepared!  Highly recommended!

4QfwTUcdNCHJqKCxDhJyZA.text: We went on a Sunday morning and it was busy but no line to be seated (unless you wanted to sit outside). We ordered the Havana latte and it was amazing, came out quickly to boot! The wait for food was very long but it was a very small place with not a lot of staff so it was understandable. The food was also well worth the wait however, I have never had hash like this before and the waffle cisco was a whole experience in it self! Don't come starving and bring someone you want a lot of time to talk to because the food is worth twice the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Havana latte

3gK9hTYczTSlmitziXZrOQ.text: The food here is amazing - I had the Mediterranean omelet and couldn't eat it slow enough it was SO good. I also had the Lavender tea and could NOT believe how amazing the flavor was. Definitely my new favorite tea. Staff were wonderful and willing to help with anything we asked - even local recommendations for hair salon.

4Jl4uINjb5vCPmqR5PQkBg.text: If I could give six stars I would. Cozy, cute little breakfast place. With very friendly staff and excellent, fresh food. Our kids loved it, we loved it and happy that we found the place. So different from many other artificial places around here.

fYVzuA7AZptG4YUXwEVIaQ.text: Excellent niche restaurant.  I have eaten multiple times and always left please and eager to return. I purposely order something different each time and have never disappointed.  Tory has waited on our party more than once. She's personable and knowledgeable about the food they serve.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Jamaican rice, jerk chicken, with generous amounts of olives and onions.

UZAM7kZItkAK6TZ9pn2J3Q.text: I took my mother there and had a beautiful day sitting outside. We had the pesto omelet which was very tasty and the Monte Cristo sandwich. Excellent. I plan to go back there with friends.

RvqjTO_wXKl_Ovx3a_LVqw.text: We came to Phoenix for a wedding and struggled to find a good breakfast spot till the last morning we were in town. Finding this place saved the day. Excellent food, good coffee and friendly staff.  The owner was around and made small talk with us while we waited. If you are in a rush don't come here but if you want to enjoy the conversation of your group and eat well this is the spot. Plus the green chile sauce was good and that is huge coming from our group since we are from New Mexico where food is all about it. Thanks Alo Cafe for saving the day!

ZLcX7cZX9hr8PHJ16JO6pA.text: We ate Sat morning at thus quant small gem in old town scottsdale. i had the corn beef hash. it was an 8. good but they did not tell me ut had cinnamon in it. ok though. wife had a breakfast sandwich as they had run out of spanish omlet. the couple next to us got the last pieces. 40 min wait fir more. when we were done the cook came out and presented my wife with a fresh cooked spanish omlet first class they get an 11 for service

26TjrdXg8ga14RexqhKy2w.text: Food was delicious and staff was super friendly and welcoming. They were very accommodating of food restrictions. Truly a hidden gem.

E2eYTaLqMjR0ZoenpU0W8A.text: Very cute place. Kinda hidden behind a design place. They are very dog friendly. There is a water bowl on the patio. Our waitress kept filling it with cool water for our dog. Even gave hime a milk bone. Food was wonderful. Had the Monte Cristo. Even better then the famous one at DisneyLand. Very attentive servers. Will be back.

3ObAopzjWLR8hyVQItPPOQ.text: This place is a hidden gem in Old Town. Low key but with the most interesting breakfast menu in the city. I had a croque croissant which was very filling but delish with the accompanying sour cream and jelly. Topped it off with a horchata latte and was spinning for the rest of the day like a boss. This place doesn't have immaculate interior design but who cares when the food is so damn good. There's plenty of places nearby that look great but have crappy food if that's more your bag...

0BUS46mBAzn7N5BjHRbBuA.text: The food is delicious and the atmosphere is adorable. The patio is a great spot to sit and have a delicious breakfast.

M_qyENSKcHSSimxk7m5_Fw.text: Four words: The Smoky Tuscany Omelet.  The omelet is currently on Alo's New Specials Menu. If someone from Alo is reading this, may I ask: is this heavenly dish on its way to becoming a permanent menu item?  Also, thank you for introducing me to Curried Ketchup.

E-3WAdT2ioyyIdRF-hHxeQ.text: Went to this cute little cafe with a small group of friends.  Such a nice place.  Food was great and the service was also.  Great place for breakfast or brunch.

8GvYdk5bVg7x4T-B4c8ZTQ.text: I went here for breakfast this morning. It's tucked away from the street I passed it twice. It's right behind a store.  My grandma is from Spain and I've been craving her Spanish tortillas. Which are very very different from Latin type. There's isn't perfect or correct. They provide you with a slice of the "tortilla" that resembles more of a quiche. When I told the waitress it was different. She explained it's made in a big portion kind of like a pie. The food was still delicious but 8$ for a slice of a pre-made quiche is kind of ridiculous. I'm still giving 4 stars because the food still was good and the staff was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sitting outside. This place is kind of tucked away.

lb85Ddjz9CfE1GjkPD8_ow.text: I really enjoyed this place even though it's so small you can pretty much count on sitting outside. It can be really hot but they provide plenty of shade. With that being said the important thing is that the food is really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waffle Cristo

pixKe8qUVCdcKY_J5TE4tw.text: AMAZING! The food here is delicious! I ordered the signature corn flake crusted french toast with fresh fruit compote and it was delicious. The waitress was extremely friendly and accommodating. Would recommend this place most definitely to anyone who lives here. I was visiting but if I was a local I would definitely be a regular and if you are visiting definitely check it out it's the cutest little breakfast/brunch spot with some delicious bites it does not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo Signature Corn Flake Crusted French Toast

bUvP1V-MBLUPGAbVKDKPMA.text: Alo Cafe is a small hidden gem tucked away with a globally inspired menu that is made from scratch!  We went here on a Sunday morning for Brunch. At first we weren't sure where the cafe was but its the brick building hidden behind Cornish Pasty. There's a few parking spots located in front of Alo, if they are full, there is free street parking offered.   They have an adorable little patio and inside it is small with some seating offered. The decor gives it a homey feel and the staff are extremely welcoming. Since many of the dishes here are inspired by Estonia and Europe, be prepared to wait for these dishes. The restaurant prides itself on making its items from scratch which falls in line with it's cultural ties.  I ordered the Horchata latte but they were out of the main ingredient. Our waitress offered to make me something similar which was a mix between their Havana and Horchata latte. She even gave me some cute latte art which was a flower.   For the food, I was torn between a couple of their dishes. I decided to try the Tortilla Espanola which was reminiscent of a quiche but had a few more ingredients. I tried the traditional Romesco sauce which was a mix of a red wine paste, red peppers and almonds. If you have a nut allergy stay away from the Romesco, but they offer an alternative of Garlic Aoli. It was light and filling enough that I had room for dessert.  My husband ordered the Monte Cristo, I'm usually not a fan but this sandwich was amazing! The bread was so flavorful and made from their corn flake crusted french toast. The jam was amazing and blended perfectly. At the end of our meal, we ordered the Kringel French toast. The plate was huge but the toast was amazing! Especially with some syrup on top, yum!  Overall we had a wonderful experience at this cafe. Just remember that if you are in a hurry, this is probably not the restaurant for you. Sometimes you have to wait for quality and food made from scratch. I highly recommend and this as a nice twist from the traditional breakfast we eat here in America.

Zm8YG9OVq1bbarIf6keZMA.text: Here on vacay and am pleasantly surprised. Quaint and groovy with delicious food and efficient service. Good vibes.

A_07aJpkyCwmRIrF-ug0mA.text: Overrated. That's generally my thought after dining here. On my last visit I ordered the Huevos de Madrid but received an omelet stuffed with cream cheese. Was too bad as the cream stuffed  omelet sucked. When addressing with the service, she took off a dollar $1.00. This was the charge for the side of salsa I had asked for when I ordered the Huevos that never came.  On the positive, decent atmosphere and good location. Will insist on elsewhere next time others want to go here.

Sc4uPzz7jG65xVhk2HXp4g.text: They old saying, "Don't judge a book by its cover..." comes to mind.   This eclectic little cafe is near the old town Scottsdale arts district, just a short walk from my hotel.  At first glance, it wasn't much to look at, but don't be deceived... it has a lot to offer.   Thanks to the Cactus Bowl yesterday, they were quite busy today. The only waitress was the epitome of "grace under pressure", as she and the owner (Steve) worked to accommodate everyone, and provide excellent service.   I had the chi-town heat omelette, with potatoes, and a side of South African breakfast sausage. Everything was AWESOME.  I would describe the menu as "eclectic international".  Try the house made curry ketchup on the savory potatoes...  BTW, the coffee was outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5ypXi-2ZxPkXs523jyWtDw.text: Really enjoyed our food. Close to our stay at Hotel Valley Ho. I had the Waffle Cristo and my husband devoured his Waffle Barge! Our server delightful and we arrived perfectly after the morning rush. Definitely recommend and will visit again!  Only con-no breakfast mimosas or bloody mary.

sAYtiQcpYP3AMDsHZV7s8g.text: LEGIT Breakfast/Brunch spot in Old Town Scottsdale! I'm very particular When it comes to food (self-proclaimed foodie), and this place was off the chain! We ordered the Pastrami breakfast burrito, the poutine omelette, and both were incredible! The homemade pastrami in the burrito went so well with the eggs and potatoes I couldn't stop eating from the first bite. The poutine omelette Was really good too, homemade gravy a top and omelette with hashbrowns and cheese curds inside. So yummy I would recommend to anyone whether you're a resident of the area or visiting! Enjoy!

v9D4ZSoNA-K-wIZZ6E6nKw.text: Quaint, homey restaurant with friendly service. The Monte Cristo was great and the Yucatan omelet with chipotle sauce was very tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Monte Cristo French Toast Sandwich

KCAqthtqJrFsB0fWzcxFJg.text: First time visit for Sunday Brunch. And perfect place to catch up with a good friend after 11 months. Enjoyed their amazing Green Hatch Chile Omelette. Can't wait to come back to try the corned beef hash with egg and their Monte Cristo Waffle. Quaint and lovely place with made to order fresh dishes. Thank you!

_1NEota-diW6CcZLpexH0Q.text: Great spot for breakfast!  Food was great and the service was terrific.  Highly recommend it!

-5eR-mViQwL8-Vc2iF7ofA.text: Have been seeing Alo on my recommended places on Yelp for quite some time now and finally decided to stop in with some friends last Saturday. It's very hidden behind old town Scottsdale to the point where I didn't feel like that's where we were eating. Very quaint and cool setup with a lot of outdoor seating options. The service was quick and were very helpful in recommending options. They recommended the burrito and I'm glad they did. One of the better breakfast burritos I've had in the Phoenix area. Will be going back!

4iKxOgK9nDs7imSep9pEQA.text: This place is a really nice tiny restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch. This place may seem like a shack, but the food is amazing. I got a xuban sandwich which was excellent and my friend got the fried french toast which was just amazing. I didn't get a photo of it, but i recommend the french toast a lot!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dGvPZ_RxCgsQakK6kHRTcw.text: Great little spot! Hot, delicious coffee, incredible food, prompt and delightful service, beautiful intimate outdoor seating (about 30 seats), and cozy indoor seating (about 20?). Gluten and dairy free food and beverages offered.   This was literally some of the best breakfast food I have ever eaten, in any of the dozen or so countries I've been to, no joke. The Waffle Cristo was to die for! Soft, hot waffle with melted Swiss, both ham and turkey, and an over-easy egg, served with jam and the thickest maple syrup I've ever had on the side. Crispy bacon and potatoes made everything even better; I even tried their house-made curry ketchup (despite not loving curry), and combined with the rosemary on the potatoes my taste buds were singing! My Americano was nice and hot, and so big I could've gotten half to go! Low-level tunes by Pink Floyd, Zeppelin, CCR, etc, and fall breezes made for a very relaxing morning. What a gem, I can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waffle Cristo with a side of breakfast potatoes and crispy bacon. So delicious!

u0dbWDMyxHSMQ2mYNtS2Bg.text: Delicious food, friendly staff. The way you want your neighborhood breakfast place to be.

dyGjYKfhBPYiYLAwslKD3Q.text: Came to Alo Cafe and their French toast was amazing. Their hash not the best. Their teas are delicious and claiming very earthy.

RUBBj1BpncutGCuKCrddxQ.text: 4 years coming to this lovely neighborhood gem and the food has always been amazing. Most recently, Lacey and crew have revamped the entire experience. Service is amazing, friendly and a joy. It's definitely my weekend go to spot.

3J6MPUOMMFKzz_vwEEDrLg.text: Excellent breakfast options and a quiet patio that is perfect for winter and spring in Arizona.

G73OdtSekQuFDEPj-zf-WQ.text: A quaint little cafe tucked between two buildings.  The service was good and the food great.  No complaints, coffee was HOT.  Excellent choice for a quick breakfast before getting on the road or going to work.

The pancakes were mosit a s fluffy, the compote had a harmonious blend of flavor, the curried rice was the best I've ever had. VZdTgFcBPIw6jko2q8SCtA.text: It's small and it has a limited menu. And it's just about perfect. A tasty reflection of its owners, I really felt like I could see their lives in the place. I don't know them, but their history is revealed everywhere here.   Outstanding coffee, a perfect breakfast and loved the rosemary roasted potatoes.

Ykan8C_b70fYHfAa5RNQZQ.text: I stumbled upon this sweet little spot on an early Tuesday morning. The place was very inviting and charming with a great home feeling. As I entered the cafe, i seemed to be the very first guest of the day and I was greeted by a beautifully sweet server, Sarah, who catered to my every need in a timely manner and was as charming and as welcoming as a server can get.   I sat inside the cozy interior and was given a  menu and my drink order was placed. I chose the iced latte with 2 shots of espresso and might I say it was one of the best iced lattes I've ever had. It was very nice to see that all of the coffee drinks are made in house and Sarah did an amazing job with my drink. I later ordered breakfast; the chitown omelette which was recommended to me and  I'd absolutely recommend to anyone! The perfect balance of spicy and savory from the sausage with a hint of sweetness from the cream cheese filling. Add this with a side of perfectly cooked house potatoes and you have a breakfast experience that you won't soon forget. The delicious food, the incomparable service, and the small cafe atmosphere here is something that has me begging for more and I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu.

3AwOlLzqFxA_wSiVM0DFtw.text: I wanted the equivalent of a farmer's breakfast, which was not a menu item. The owner wouldn't budge on charging each add on of $4 eggs, $7 French toast, $3 per sausage. I don't want to spend $17 for a basic breakfast that is $10 everywhere else. This is what makes it difficult to support small business.

ifRqzon3mB84F_RGZR53Xw.text: 4.5 stars is unfortunately a little too much for this place.  The food was good but the service was slow and the wait for food was ridiculous. Nice atmosphere.  Just a tip for the waitress...even if the wait for food is long, don't tell your customers that when they walk in...nice notice but you scare off too many people...bad for business

dPMqwZSWtl1-fsOHimppvQ.text: Loved this gem in Old Town.   Found on Yelp and decided to give it a try.  Got seated immediately on patio.  Food came out in minutes and was delicious.   I had a cheesee and mushroom omelette.   The side potatoes were a hit for my husband,  daughter and me.  Definitely will be back.

HdgFL0AgvLG_7mHhp76xRQ.text: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast here this morning. I selected the Monte Cristo while he had the Corned Beef Hash with poached eggs and rye toast. From the service to the tasty food (and unique curry ketchup) it was a 5star winning breakfast. I'm only disappointed that it's our last morning in Scottsdale before returning to Atlanta as we would have enjoyed trying more menu items. It's a definite destination for anyone that lives for great food/service.

thym6AUROOMClEFA7OcSOQ.text: Perfect little cafe! The service is personal and lovely. Very small venue and don't be in a rush for the handcrafted food. Hubby had the waffle crusto and I had the grilled cheese with bacon and tomato on sourdough. 10:30 on a Saturday morning a little busy.
