J-n2D82WrBda6RJbHIFeoA.text: This place is a hidden gem! The cafe is super cute and the service was wonderful. It is located at the very edge of downtown Scottsdale, which makes it super easy to get to. I ordered an iced Horchata Latte which was delicious, and the Yucatan Omelette with chicken instead of shrimp. This omelette was to die for. They should definitely add this chicken version to their menu! The omelette came with these amazing seasoned potatoes and a drizzle of chipotle cream sauce. The chipotle cream sauce was so yummy that I asked for a side of it and dipped every bite (including the potatoes) into it! I will DEFINITELY be coming back to Alo Cafe.

9mSpiQfhCQqUbNZVedrqzQ.text: Was a cute little place for breakfast. Food is definitely not worth the money. We ordered a all special waffle because it also had Nutella ( can't help, I'm a huge fan!). I got the waffle without the Nutella and not so many fruits on it. I had to ask for it again. I feel the waffles were already soaked by the whipped cream and overall, didn't like it. Cappuccino was great though. Also had pesto omlette and chicken Marsala omlette which were good but not with the money.

I0gb3ysUumTvN6k-QDYDdw.text: Such good food.  Everything we ordered was YUM!  Small little home converted.  Tables outside on the grass.  Next time we are in town this will be our first stop.

b3_KV4XLxvpv9Az91z6qHg.text: Waffle cristo!!!! So super friendly and cozy here. They have nice outdoor seating. This place inspires happiness :)

AFaqHrcqnA4kEquHnnFuLA.text: I went to the Alo Cafe for breakfast and had a wonderful meal.  I had a Belgium Waffle and their world famous homemade patty sausage.  The waffle was excellent, but the sausage is a must have.  The service was good and I received my meal quickly.  The only downfall to this place is that tables are limited.

XKrzkMyMDpEIa5sTDiC15g.text: The atmosphere is amazing. Great tasting food with prompt and friendly service. I recommend this place for breakfast. I had the meat omelet and it was packed with bacon,sausage,ham. Their curry ketchup is amazing as well.

1tizJSya4MvXextjqXEVYA.text: Stayed in Scottsdale for a night during a roadtrip, found this place tucked away, and I'm glad we did because we enjoyed everything! We were trying to keep it cheap so just got egg & cheese sandwiches, but they were delicious, with a side of home fries and fresh fruit- perfect breakfast! The potatoes were slightly dry but they had homemade curry ketchup that tasted amazing on them. Owner and staff were very friendly and helpful.. Wish we were locals so we could support this place more!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

c5fV9EI8VpU2TINfRtczCQ.text: We had passed this restaurant a dozen times over the years but always after closing time. Finally we got ourselves out of bed on a Sunday morning to give the place a try. I read the Yelp reviews and figured I had a 50/50 chance of having a good experience. We showed up at 8:25am and were seated, placed our order, given our food and finished in 30 minutes. Yes, I timed it.  The food was very good and the service was just as good. For those who complain about service delays, try avoiding the peak hours. Any small restaurant can get easily inundated with large crowds.

_Aap0zqkvFi8b8qa2k66ow.text: Had breakfast on a Sunday morning while on vacation. The place is small and there wasn't a crowd but they took forever to get our food out. They forgot our water, coffee and when the food came out however, it was excellent. The Havana latte was particularly delightful. Good place to eat, if you don't mind the wait.

YZZIKWQd6tNR_bIGjI_8XA.text: By far, the smoothest coffee I have tasted in this area. I like it iced and black, with a delicate flavor. Their food choice is interesting, and their prices are reasonable!

aGfopr1J2QdLxILpU3zrJQ.text: What a great find. The food was excellent. I have a lot of food sensitivities and the chef was nice enough to come out and list out the ingredients his the home made sausages. The food was prepared wonderfully. I LOVED the home made ghost pepper sauce.  The menu is very eclectic and unique.   Such a wonderful find.

wRHOm6vWTZgpiXe4O_RMKg.text: So delicious! This place is incredible. Darling little old home in downtown Scottsdale that is producing fantastic food. Don't come here if you're in a hurry though, nothing speedy about it. Just come and relax and enjoy.

ylSJKYs62UryZAVxQ25gmA.text: This place is all about one thing.... the monte cristo... I didn't order this unfortunately, but the husband did... and it was fabulous... potentially life changing. I, on the other hand, ordered a pesto omelette aaaand it was just ok. The coffee was good, the service was on point, and the prices were decent. We'll definitely be back!

2EKTbnmECZCNuj8duijIJg.text: The place is extremely small, very claustrophobic. I couldn't move without touching or bumping into someone else. The waiter couldn't even get to our table, she had to physically pass us the food to put it down or she would bump into the other customers. We had to wait 25 mins for our food and didn't get check on to see if we enjoyed it. The food was fine but I personally wouldn't go back because of the ambiance.

iGRvaUEaxJBgNjrO3cSjXA.text: Actually very disappointed. Heard a lot of good things. Cute little neighborhood place but food did not measure up. Service was fine but the kitchen was very slow. Table on each side of us waited over 50 minutes for their food. When their's came we asked if  it was worth the wait. Both tables pretty much said 'Eh'. After about 45 minutes our food finally showed up and it was 'Eh' too. We did order a fresh baked apricot scone which was awesome! And the Americano coffees were very good. Bacon was severely under cooked and fatty. Toast & bruschetta that came with the omelettes had a peculiar tasted, potatoes tasted greasy and omelettes just OK. Too many excellent places for brunch in the area to won't be heading back.

dxuJvAOsjzoUG7bpxHmf-w.text: We were happy to finally find a neat little breakfast cafe with character while visiting family in Arizona. The service was excellent and breakfast was great. I kept it simple with two eggs over-easy, sausage links, potatoes, and rye bread, while my husband tried a chorizo omelette with cheese and a green sauce on top. I can't remember what it was called, but I liked it a lot. They have curry ketchup to go with the potatoes, just like they have in Germany. My over-easy eggs were cooked perfectly, with just the right amount of salt. I couldn't decide between the eggs or the Estonian dessert bread French toast. Kinda regret that I didn't get to try the French toast, but everything was great nonetheless. Highly recommend stopping in if you're visiting Scottsdale.

53qXHMa23gAZiO_aqob8xA.text: Looking for breakfast in downtown Scottsdale, Alo Cafe fit the bill.  Small place tucked in an alley was a little hard to find at first.  Really cute patio area with a small inside eating area.  Sat ourselves down in the patio and waited for service.  And waited for service.  Took a while to get menus, then a while to get water/drinks, etc.  Server was real nice but didn't come around often.  Had a waffle, french toast and omelet.   Everything was very good, although the omelet was a little small for me (maybe 2 eggs?).  Also had a chicken salad sandwich to go which was also very good.  They use a flavorful combination of seasonings.  Prices are very reasonable, location is great, wi-fi, food is very good.  Docked 1 star for the slow service and a couple of food issues.

OiH9oQB3HJAB0WZNODvTQA.text: Great little place for breakfast! It's hidden behind a small bakery, so look for the sign they have out front. We ordered an omelette and they brought out  a curry ketchup that they make in house and it was SO GOOD. Definitely something to ask for!

rTXZeueNPbZuKHSnICUzZg.text: TL;dr --average to good food, good atmosphere, TERRIBLE service.  I'll start out with the good.  Alo is adorably nestled out of the hustle and bustle of Old Town Scottsdale.  The menu had variety but wasn't overwhelming.  The atmosphere, on a good day, would have been charming.  I would rate the food quality fairly high, but only because I tasted the food on my friends' plates.  Here is where we get to the bad.  We arrived at Alo, excited about the almost-five-star rating, and cute location.  We got there around 9:30 am, to beat the worst of the Scottsdale rush.  As we approached, I noticed several grumpy faces on the half dozen people waiting to be seated/served.  It looked busy, but not slammed.  When we put our name in for a table and were told to wait about 15 minutes for a seat, the hostess seemed flustered and confused, almost as if she was surprised that anyone showed up to eat at the restaurant that morning.  She asked us where we wanted to sit as if we had a choice, and as if it weren't her responsibility to find us an open table.  During the wait time, I witnessed at least one angry customer complaining to the hostess about the wait for his table or food.  We were finally seated 15-20 minutes later, and it was at least another 10 minutes before a waitress came to bring our water.  Someone came back to take out food orders about 10 minutes after that, and I am pretty sure it was a different waitress.  It seemed like they didn't have assigned tables or sections.  She offered one of the guests at our table gluten-free toast as a substitute for normal bread, which was a major plus.    We waited about 20 minutes for our food, which is a little bit on the long side for eggs/sausages/tea, but not completely unreasonable.  When the food arrived, they forgot my food (or got the order completely wrong--still unclear).  I sent back what they brought (not even CLOSE to my order), and awaited the replacement patiently.  Also, my friend asked to be sure that her toast was actually gluten free, just to confirm.  The waitress seemed very offended or annoyed that she would even ask, but confirmed that it was, in fact, the gluten-free toast.  My food never came.  No one came back to check on us.  No one refilled our water.  No one brought us silverware (I had to go inside and ask the very confused hostess where I could get my own silverware).  After we had been finished eating for OVER 20 minutes, our 11:15 appointment was quickly approaching so I gave up on my food.  My friend went inside to ask for the check.  She had to do this twice.  Of course, when they brought the check, my food was still on it.  We promptly sent it back, with no apology or question from the waitress about whether I actually wanted my food.  The waitress seemed annoyed that we brought it up at all.  My overall impression of the staff is that they had no patience for the customers, no desire to serve the customers, and generally no desire to be in business at all.    I've been to many a brunch in the Phoenix area, and most are INSANELY busy on a Sunday.  The staff members are usually experienced and handle the rush with grace or at least tolerance.  Mistakes happen, but one would expect an apology or remedy of some kind.  I will not be returning to Alo Cafe or recommending it to any of my friends.

cqBpHeCzkVdNXodqyAMksw.text: Great food, I had the breakfast sandwich and my friend had the French toast. Their ice tea is also very good! It is a very small and quaint cafe type feel, and is tucked away in old town and has a very different (but good) vibe compared to other places in this area.   The reason for the 3/5 stars is for the service. The waiters all share tables to they often forgot or took a very long time to come over or bring us something we asked for. They were all nice and I would get confused remembering who is doing what. They also need new umbrellas out front. It was nice in the shade but unfortunately their umbrellas had tons of huge rips and the sun was beating down on us.   I would come back but probably get the food to go or sit inside to at least not be so hot.

bIzvgCUuUVglls2onLYSMg.text: Outstanding small breakfast restaurant. Conveniently located down the street from Cholla trail - Camelback mountain. I'm enjoying one of the best coffees I've ever had, strong, bold and with a lot flavor.  My chicken Marsala omelette is delicious.

U2pvFA1aVU8cY9VNDs2Ksw.text: The red head that works here needs to go!!  The food was good. Had the breakfast sandwich while husband had an omelette.  But the service was horrible. Only three tables and she forgot who ordered what. Never brought out the potatoes for another table. Told me cole slaw was included with my breakfast sandwich when it wasn't (they ended taking it off the bill).   One extra star because they have Marie Sharp's hot sauce even though technically they were running out. Just had some remaining end juice.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

pMFXrbV2rGx6l_Atp6y34g.text: Amazing food everything was so good, small breakfast place , very sweet Waitress ,very nice too , just loved it , loved the assortment of jams !!!

7qxtK5pojmnQ7nJibuGPag.text: My hotel offered free breakfast but it looked disgusting.  The hotel said we could go to US Egg.  That was mediocre.  My research then dug up Alo Cafe where we went the next day.  This was the best.  A gourmet breakfast experience for US Egg prices.  I had the breakfast sandwich.  It was delish.  My husband had traditional breakfast platter.  His raisin bread and my roll were bakery-quality.  Coffee was good.  My husband had a choice of exotic teas and chose lavendar Earl Grey.  It's great to try new things.  If only the hotel had recommended Alo instead of US egg.

jb-jjII0B7FE96iBZbUB-Q.text: Literally the most amazing Corned Beef Hash of my life!  Not your traditional taste with a little extra spice but OMG!!  Thank you Alo Cafe for a great start to my morning.

wvCcGrIwEINzf4M0ISR0-Q.text: I will say, the main reason I give this place 4 stars instead of 3 is because of the uniqueness of the food. Ordered a shrimp and salmon omelette, which I had never seen listed on a menu before, along with many other items. Don't get me wrong, it was very good, but the eggs were a bit runny and the salmon was way over-cooked. Potatoes were potatoes...one of the best food items there in my opinion was their Curry ketchup! SO good if you like both curry and ketchup, and again, something I had never seen previously.   The coffee was average, the service was good but not great, and the atmosphere is cute and quaint, but didn't feel as friendly as it should have when we walked in.   If you're looking to try some unique breakfast food, give it a go, but it wouldn't be my top choice to recommend around Old Town Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon and shrimp omelette with potatoes

Mo6NXbj4auV3CkBR7pvvRQ.text: This place is really good. Small place with a really cool vibe and atmosphere. Try the cornflake crusted French toast with compote. Amazing!

lhH2rKSAUtKI1RnL0lsYiA.text: This is by far my favorite hidden gem! I had breakfast here and I would definitely suggest getting the Monte Cristo Waffle (I don't think that's the exact name but something similar to that) IT'S SINFUL and sooooo good.   There is little room inside but a nice patio outside surrounded by pretty flowers and trees! The patio is nestled between the restaurant and what I think is an office of some sort.

FLPv2-fp11kYdeGAAPE9uA.text: This review is over due (my apologies) I'm still dreaming of their hash and Yerba matte tea! It was awesome and I can not wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Chicago something omelette oh yea, really good!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. In house made corned beef hash

kdb8AfvK3n1XP8q9oXUH7g.text: This is such a great breakfast place! The inside is small, but the patio is a great choice on a nice morning. We were able to try their waffles, caprese omelet and corned beef hash. All were outstanding and worth the wait, which wasn't long. Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable. The homemade curry ketchup was very unique and not too spicy. My family would go back in a heartbeat!

JFe4D2Eu_D1kVbZnLgoitQ.text: It doesn't look like much more than a simple cafe, but it was so good! Waitress is awesome and so upbeat. I think she was the only one working but attended to all our needs! Breakfast food is fantastic. I recommend the French toast with fresh fruit compote. Also their boutique tea if delicious.

TJe3XPzCagk6XEns7SoziQ.text: The selection of fun things to both eat and drink here are what has brought me back a few times. Located down the street from my office, and one of two places usually open in time for me to get breakfast if needed, this place rocks.

aEJYhv1ZMD1W5mFk6H-p4w.text: Alo Cafe is a quaint spot right behind Cornish Pasty in Old Town. The outdoor patio is so cute, but there were not outdoor outlets to plug in my laptop. There is free wifi, and plenty of outlets inside. Everyone working was so friendly, the chef even came to talk to myself and another table about our food! I tried the iced tea and it was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Coffee is from Cartel Coffee Lab (the owner of Cartel help them get set up to open, according to the chef), and is really good! Food is good - would be a great spot for breakfast or lunch!

-a8wqJjbG2d8aJge4b3Wrg.text: Great neighborhood cafe!!! Coffee is always delicious & strong, and the food causes your tastebuds to do the happy dance!! I've been to Alo multiple times; the service and friendliness is always spot on!!

G6JtuL0hetnPgN8wugHrPQ.text: Awesome omelettes and waffles, really good potatoes too. Kind of hard to spot from the street but very worth finding. We came on a Wednesday so it wasn't packed but I could see it being really busy on the weekends with the food they serve.

j1ikkyaBK0SqXvVvcohdVA.text: The owner has traveled all over the world and creates his menu based on his favorite finds. The international cafe serves items such as rusks, tortilla espanola, and Jamaican jerk curry chicken. I went here for breakfast and was pleased to see they serve Cartel Coffee which is locally roasted in Tempe. I had the Meditterrean omelet which came with Rosemary roasted potatoes. There are 20 different types of hot sauces to choose from. I also had the French toast with fruit compote. The French toast was soft and chewy on the inside and had a nice cereal type outer coating.

nVlYfPviLg-Jo0sOSOMFYQ.text: A definite must try!  We ordered the the Monte Cristo and the Tuscan Omelet this morning.  Both were delicious indeed.  The staff was delightful and the restaurant quaint and comfortable.  We'll be back!

kiMgDFbRG698W5Liao1ZVw.text: I am glad to say that Alo cafe has dramatically improved their service in recent months!! When I last left a review they seemed to be under staffed but they certainly listened to their feedback and stepped up their game! This place is definitely one of our favorite breakfast places and we make a trip here at least once a week. It is a little tucked away from the main bustle of old town Scottsdale but definitely give this place a try if you are looking for a solid breakfast and brunch spot that has a cozy and comfortable environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Belgian waffle. French toast with fruit compote. French toast special with cinnamon swirl bread and fruit compote

-UL99P81XNyMNWleB-XPkw.text: Superior service. Great coffee. Can't wait to come back often to explore the delectable menu.

kCeitfW_jguh_M-1ryYTpQ.text: Went here today for breakfast and loved it! Tried the 2 egg combo with potatoes and toast. Food was fresh and good. Also tried the Chai latte what was ok. The place is small but really cute. Everyone who worked there was nice and made us feel welcomed. We will be back!

IyAiXTZ83ygYrkYAsaqGzQ.text: Breakfast was delicious! Loved their French toast with fruit compote and the curry ketchup was awesome touch!

AxodiX2dxXKh91mJfg7-TQ.text: Stopped in for breakfast twice. The foot was excellent, the staff was very friendly and offered information about local events and venues. The staff was also happy to explain the menu and specialties. This place is a must if your in the area!

furYpMxzyxsQtGFyOzKmNw.text: Wow!  Pancakes with fruit compote was Amazing!  Friendly staff too!  If I lived here id be here often.

q3hkOVOxlrrEP7_kxO5dEA.text: Amazing hole in the wall. Love the ambiance. Owner sat us down and talked to us for a bit. Food took a while but it didn't bother me when I tasted it. Worth the wait. Small staff that cares. Refreshing to receive personal attention at a restaurant. Will surely return And let my friends know about this gem.

Xhui7DP2nNmIG98LILudsA.text: This is a great independent cafe with very good food.  For breakfast everything is good but the Waffle Cristo has a special place in my heart.

E8yXd4uDdaAoXN93x7HRPw.text: Cozy cafe atmosphere.  Food top notch from scratch.  Pancakes REALLY tasty.  Huevos Madrid with smoked salmon and shrimp outstanding.  Cartel coffee was perfect and owners are so friendly!

E4cYOBXOfRmJN5KcJMh6rw.text: Great food. Like most people, I had to try the Monte Cristo waffle. It was to die for! Adorable patio area, quiet place to enjoy some breakfast and coffee. We'll be back...soon!

rqaH910goTP9QzdeC2BsPQ.text: I was sad to hear there was no corned beef for a Reuben but It ended well because the BLTA or bacon, lettuce, tomato, avocado was the bomb!! The  horchata latte was as good as it was pretty. Love this little place and the patio seating. I'll be going back for that Reuben!!

s8qeiZxXjZQqOCe11S3Wdw.text: Second time here, and once again they are awesome. I meant to write a review last time but I was too busy recommending Alo to all my friends. Great original menu and friendly service.

y98LCMdMK9NjKB_DiyIbEQ.text: Delicious. If you are a seafood lover, try the huevos de Madrid! Put some curry katsup sauce on it and go to town. Very friendly and interesting staff. They source their yerba mate fixings from Argentina. It's good stuff.  The owner seems to have traveled all over the world and brought back all of his favorite recipes and ingredients. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about it. Great place!! Small, intimate setting.

ehb0pekUBWy44asRJbx0ZQ.text: What an amazing little brunch find in Scottsdale! Menu has many international items and everything is made fresh. We had the Waffle Crisco and 3 egg pastrami burrito and they both exceeded our expectations - add a couple of Havana coffees (iced!!) and we we're in brunch heaven. Service was friendly and prompt. Definitely recommend Alo Cafe  for a casual brunch with friends :)

npHYiTfo8bmIOCzRJAEBOw.text: Great experience twice and will be back for more. Tried the burrito, which is good. The second day tried the lox omelette, way out of my comfort zone but gave it a try and actually is the best omelette I've ever had. Excited to try more things there. Like the atmosphere and the teamwork environment they have between the employees.

rslt1dBd5djwcufTp9HV5Q.text: This place is crazy bomb!!! If you like waffles, do try their waffle special...so good... with grilled pineapple, bananas, and fresh cream. Their omelets are awesome too. I usually take pictures of my food lol.... but it looked so good, I didn't even want to take the time to take pics lol and then it was all gone.  Service is great too, nice waitress, cute patio to eat outside at, check it out!

wW-3YZCY2OCPeB1CWjLOnQ.text: I really wanted to like this place.  It's so cute and the staff seems nice but we were really hoping for more on the food front.  The pastrami burrito had almost no pastrami on it while the tortilla espanola was both bland and lukewarm.  For the quality, we felt that they were both overpriced.  The french toast and coffees were both good but that's about it.    Service wasn't particularly good either, unfortunately.  The place was busy but I was disappointed to see several tables of people who were seated after us (and ordered after us) get served before us.  Some of them even had time to finish and pay before we were served.  We had to ask for refills on water, coffee, etc.  All in, it took us 75 mins to get served breakfast for 4 people. Definitely not worth the wait.

VUMU1_r8lPYxDrqGRDTC8A.text: Alo Cafe is this cute little spot tucked away behind Cornish Pasty in the corner of 1st Street and Goldwater. It's truly a Global Cafe with beautiful outdoor seating. I love the concept. The menu is interesting and features items from across the globe.  ~ Cold brew $3.50 ~ Omelette with cheddar, green pepper, onion and potatoes $8 ~ Scrambled eggs, muffin and potatoes $8  Pros: Great Coffee Generous Portions Comfort Food Cute Cafe  Cons: the potatoes were overdone to the point of being a little burned. tables and floor were not clean.  I wanted to be blown away by this place but it was just Okay.  Cheers!

lDsWWL4-2xBj8UMmD9uVuA.text: This has been my favorite breakfast spot in the phoenix area since last year. The atmosphere is cute and the food is decent but the service has always lacked. 10 minutes after we sat down we ordered our drinks and asked to order our food also, our waitress said no because other people were there before us and weren't ready to order yet. Then, she brought our drinks (consisting of water and juices) 15 minutes after we ordered them and yet again told us we had to wait to order our food. We were on a time crunch so we went inside after about 35-40 minutes of not getting our food, to complain but the only people who were working were out of sight, so we left. So, I wouldn't recommend going to this restaurant unless you plan to beg to order your food.

v4TwmGPS-L-Iuy_18CQMqg.text: Cute, Local Restaurant with a European Flair  Alo Cafe is tucked away near the heart of Scottsdale. The menu is a fun departure from the standard brunch fare found in most Scottsdale restaurants. We ordered the Hatch Omelette and Monte Cristo. The Monte Cristo was a yummy sweet and savory option, and the omelette was decent. The quaint ambiance was the highlight of our experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qadu8kEVCo4vY61ObiAIlg.text: What a great find. It's tucked away behind Cornish Pasty in Scottsdale.  The place is small and a bit cramped but friendly and interesting - the patio will be nice when the weather cools.  I love their menu. Lots of choices and interesting global influence.  For example, the Rusks are an African version of biscotti.  Spanish tortilla omelette.   Great selection of beverages - we opted for the chai lattes, but were also considering the lemon ginger ice tea.    We finally chose the Monte Cristo and the Waffle Barge.  The Monte Cristo was delish - made with their cornflake French toast.  My husband is very picky about his waffles, and he was pleased that the waffle exterior was crisp, so it held up nicely with all the fruit and Nutella goodness.    There were so many great choices we want to try next visit. Omelettes, and savory dishes as well.  And the baked scones!  Yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ThkvbHt2-eDTOnqppFSkeA.text: Finally got to try the Monte Cristo Waffle that everyone's been raving about and I can understand the hype behind it. It's the best mix of sweet and savory and every bite was a drop of heaven (insert Friends reference here)   It is definitely a smaller place, but if you ever get a chance to go - try the Monte Cristo Waffle and get a side of hash browns. Will definitely be back to try more things, but to be honest I don't know what will top the Monte Cristo Waffle.

TB876GmnamqAw6VPU4FamA.text: This place is so cute!  I really want to try it.  It's tiny and sweet, but the service is so slow.  That's not always a bad thing.  If you want to spend a lot of time enjoying coffee and a lovely atmosphere, this is the spot.   Unfortunately I was there to eat breakfast.  Not much food coming out of this kitchen.  Just tables full of people waiting, and talking, and drinking coffee.

jkkQhCSmCxyAgf-8JlspkQ.text: A quiet hidden small cafe, tucked away behind the Cornish Pasty company. What a nice change from the hot spots on the main drag, with too much noise first this in the morning. The breakfasts here are delicious, filling and the coffee is better than most breakfast places in-fact it might be better Starbucks ! I was looking for something local, and now I've found it, I'll be back. Service was great, ladies were very helpful in helping me choose. Sit outside if weather permits, it's very casual but that's part of the charm of this old building !

dQbrGlODk-QZ9Uq52ZeUGg.text: I wanted to fall in love with this place. The food is outstanding, and the menu is eclectic. In a small cozy beautiful setting; however, you can apparently get lost in an 8 table restaurant and I was apparently so hidden away, the basics were denied from me.  Firstly no silverware, but that was corrected, when I got my beautiful Huevos Espanol, which was excellent. I got my cup of coffee, and for the first time in my life, I got irked, largely do to, when I asked was asked if I'd like another cup of coffee I said sure, waiter walked off and I thought I get that second cup of coffee however he was never to be seen. A waitress came by and I said can I get a second cup of coffee and she said sure. However, I never saw her again either.  When the waiter came by to give me my check and ask if there was anything else. I said no you kind of ruined it,  he gave me that smirk on his face where you just like to slap it right off. That's when I decided I will never come back here again it wasn't Coffee it was this lack of professionalism. Just act professional. Also, he was the first waiter I have ever given an almost nothing tip to. Because he certainly didn't deserve it.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2FSlYIQ54qWDryPNr4TxwQ.text: This place is so yummy! We were in town for a short visit and came here after reading reviews on yelp. Got here about 10am on a Saturday and were seated immediately. I got the monte cristo and my boyfriend got the breakfast sandwich with sausage, both of which were full of flavor. I'm usually an egg breakfast kind of person so I'm surprised at myself for choosing the monte cristo but I figured it was their signature dish and a must try. I'm happy I did because it really was every level of unique you could have for a dish that's usually the same everywhere. The cornflake French toast, home made jam, and sour cream were random but somehow worked altogether. The green chili which I usually HATE because it's so spicy everywhere was anything but. It was made in-house, green chili grilled outside and freshly made, and definitely something I suggest trying if you usually aren't a typical spicy green chili fan. I'm not sure if we spoke with the owner or manager but one of the gentlemen working there gave us the backstory about the place and why it was called Alo (names after an Astonian composer). They even had the president of Astonia visit them a few years ago with secret service and all lol. I love mom and pop shop kinds of places that have a homey, home cooked meal feeling and this place definitely delivers that. I'd come back for sure.

twKSsFo4vlfI3n7GvaqmAQ.text: This little breakfast spot is cozy and super friendly!  The food is delicious, highly recommend.

tGqXXkxPUWhaIR55DfH4SQ.text: Service was lacking not in friendliness but attentiveness. We were told up front the food would take a bit to come out which was fine but we waited quite a bit for our drinks. It wasn't busy mind you. Then we never got refills on our waters and got checked on maybe once. Food was ok but again, when eating out we expect better service.

YDGUxqh1uGH24_93Sz2oQA.text: We were staying at the Valley Ho nearby.  We liked it so much we had breakfast there two days in a row!

4tfXllMdBe877bkKB8EAqQ.text: Rarely do I find a place where the food is really great but the rest of my experience is just so-so; usually, it's the other way around. But today at Alo Cafe I had very good food but the strangest experience.  Slow drip coffee was a wonderful start to brunch and it's nice they offer free refills - although I only got one and would've liked more. I'll get to the service a little later in the review. Ordered two of their most popular dishes: the french toast with hot fruit compote and the monte cristo waffle. Both were excellent! Also ordered a side of bacon but only got two pieces with my meal after being informed by our waitress that the cook dropped the other piece. Hmm...ok?! I waited, and waited, and after finishing the rest of meal finally got a new plate of bacon.  Which brings me to the rest of the experience. Alo Cafe is a super cute spot tucked away on a side street near Old Town Scottsdale. The exterior is quaint and reminds me of a cafe in San Diego. Unfortunately, the interior wasn't so clean and the floors were filthy. The bathroom was equally disgusting. I noticed the hand soap was watery, almost like it had been refilled with water to make it last longer -- yuck! I'll give them a pass on the overflowing restroom trashcan because I'm sure they had a busy Sunday brunch. But after a deep cleaning and with a few little touches of some cute decor, it would be soooo much better!   While we were eating, one of the chefs came out of the kitchen, walked out through the dining area and carried the most dirty, disgusting trash can out to be emptied in the parking lot. I understand a trash can is for trash -- but man, the exterior of it looked like it had never been wiped down. To walk through the dining area with it is not a good look...at all. It was unappetizing and made me think the rest of the kitchen must be filthy. I am glad I visited the restroom after eating. The floors and the rest of the interior of this cafe really really need a deep cleaning.  In terms of service, we lucked out with the ONLY waitress that was actually doing her job. But because of that, she was a little overworked. One of the other waitresses seemed to have major communication issues and some form of social anxiety. She kept delivering incorrect dishes and bills to tables. I witnessed customers having a very challenging dining experience with her. When I walked in to use the restroom, I noticed she was ducked down at the checkout counter texting on her phone. This job didn't seem like a great match for her personality. The third waitress actually seemed to be doing a descent job until I saw her walk to her car and never return -- and she still had open tables! WOW!  So... after all that is said and done, I was wavering between two and three stars. The food and exterior ambience really were great! And our waitress did a descent job for our table. So I decided to be generous and go with three stars. I truly hope they do a deep cleaning of the place and hire some better wait and kitchen staff that can serve customers because the food itself was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Two of their most popular dishes

jJwIE4uhwmeP4CLnZsQabQ.text: Had a great brunch here last week while we were visiting Scottsdale. Coming from frigid Detroit, it was a pleasure to sit outside and enjoy some warmer weather in January! The patio is lovely!   The eats were also fantastic. Both my husband and I decided to go with some of the more unique items off their menu and we were not disappointed. I went with the kringle french toast (an Estonian sweet bread) and he went with the monte cristo waffle. Both were excellent. The kringle was custardy and lightly sweet, with strawberries and whipped cream it was a decadent breakfast dish. The waffle? Man, I was pretty jealous. The perfect combo of sweet and salty. On a return visit I would definitely order that one myself.   Iced coffees were also great, and inside they have additional seating and some pastries and things you can take to go. A lovely spot that I look forward to visiting again should I find myself in Scottsdale in the future.

WzZ2sRp_pE1liuPRjbYN1Q.text: My family of four found them from Yelp. Breakfast/brunch was necessary as we were coming from Tempe on our way to pick up my car from last nights shenanigans. I had the roasted bbq pork loin special, the hubs had the Chi-town  (subbed pepper jack instead of cream cheese) and the kids each had eggs, potatoes and toast. The eggs were too soft for my & the kids' preference but perfect for the hubs. The rest of the food was spot on! Omg that pork was incredible. Everything is made to order and you can tell. We expected much slower service per the expectations set on the menu, but it was just right. Coffee was hot and tasty, hot chocolate was amazing. We will be back!

vcCVdzfRZbozs6FwpABb9g.text: I would give zero stars if I could. Sarah the blond server was inattentive, rude, and was reluctant to actually serve. She made us wait for well over 15 mins in the empty cafe, took our drink order (one hot chocolate and water), didn't bring it and blamed the kitchen for not adding whipped cream, brought it to the table dropped it off 10 mins later after we asked again and said "oh yeah we are out, hope you're okay with that" as she was walking away. Then it tasted like steamed milk only and forgot the water. By this time her service was spoiling the meal and when we asked for the manager she gave a stuck up look and said it would be a few mins. She needs to learn how to serve and be a nice human. We will not be back and we will not recommend this place to anyone.

tFv-fH_8dxZ72mei1NR-OQ.text: Delicious tea (Fountain of Youth), food (Tortilla Espanola) and great service for this visit. Fresh ingredients cooked to order. I'll be returning soon to try other items on the menu!

Just like I was at home.  Staff was friendly and knowledgable about the menu.  She never forgot about me even though I was on the patio.  The Brisket Chili was a good choice with the eggs!!

DyTyMbY_VBPJ6PEkNr4Alw.text: Super cute little cafe with great breakfast and wonderful service. Perfect for breakfast for two.

rZrXW7P-9-7q1dDrP2uYpA.text: Every time we visit Scottsdale we have breakfast at Alo Cafe. The food is consistently good and the people are very friendly. I like the build your own omelette and they make a great cappuccino. Their specials are very creative too. Next visit we plan to try a dish made with their homemade/smoked and steamed pastrami.

U1V8W7eJPc3ZysTRwgz0yg.text: The service was good. Cold Brewed coffee was solid. We tried omlettes, which we enjoyed. The French toast was the bomb. Only drawback was the seating - it's a small set up.

hDTnSzpgyD_Y50p5INC6eQ.text: This quaint little cafe was wonderful. The presumed owner greeted us at the door and seated us quickly. All of the food options sounded delicious. I ordered the Horchata latte and pesto omelet. My husband ordered the Waffle Cristo and a latte. Everything arrived quickly and was exceptionally good. We would frequent if we were locals.

PRmoNlZZdLqf0BikboQgZQ.text: Small cafe with excellent (or should I say egg-cellent?) and creative omelettes. Also very good coffee, including the horchata latte, which tasted like dessert. Pleasant and attentive servers, as well. A bit of small-town charm in big old Scottsdale.

3EVFZjolP_wrmDzteaio5A.text: Great food. Loved the breakfast burrito. Lots of little flies in the restaurant which was not pleasant while you're eating

XA1UhaPr_8oBFRJ7yzYWvQ.text: We came to Scottsdale for a girl's weekend. We agreed this was one of the BEST breakfasts we have ever had. (And we know breakfast) Knowledgeable staff, unique food and quaint atmosphere. Croissant French toast with fruit compote was heavenly. Pesto omelette was perfection. Don't overlook this place!!!!

qKLHnLKt0UOplYnrjjtsqQ.text: I wish that I could give this place 0 stars because that's what they deserve. We walked out of the restaurant because we never received our food. We waited over an hour after ordering, watched multiple guests arrive well after our order was taken who were served their food, completed their meal, paid and left.  When I reported this to whoever worked there only thing that was said was "whoops, sorry."  The waiter never said a word to us. Regardless of how good you think the food is DO NOT GO HERE!!!  There are many other options in the area with better food and much better service. I'll NEVER come back and I will be sure to spread the word.

dz3vT8pP11fX4yhAC6inOQ.text: This is the hidden gem that I have been looking for in this city. So much soul in their cooking. Simple, balanced, and delicious.

VemNGbshGMjmf6_faljT0w.text: I spend a lot of time looking for quiet places to visit on my weekends that are family-owned with home cooking. I am a foody, so I don't mind paying a bit more for a better meal. Simply put, the service sucked, the owner forces the single patrons to sit outside even when the restaurant is 1/2 empty inside on a 104 day, and asside from a couple original recipes, the quality of the food sucked. I ordered the corned beef hash when he bragged about in person. I asked for it Krispy, and it came out burnt and greasy. I ordered a side of Hashbrows topped with cheese and onions. I told the server I am a lactose intolerant, and to please make sure it was light on the cheese. I think they made them loaded with cheese a soggy with grease on purpose. The only other thing I ordered was the Belgian Waffle with no toppings. Within the 5 minute drive home I was forced to make, the waffle  had become rubbery in texture. The bill came out to almost 27.00!  Oh, I left off my 1 glass of tea the server brought me with no straw and fingers all over the top of the glass where you put your mouth when you don't have a straw. I dont do these reviews often, but I hope someone reads this before having the experience I did. Denny has better quality, better options,  better service, and better prices! BE WARNED!

r2PjNxi5WStEIwrUbYORmQ.text: My best friend claims this place as her secret spot. Since I am her best friend I convinced her to share it with me. We started off with some coffee - definitely not something that was impressive. However, we moved right along to our main course, The Chi Town omelet and Kringle. You can't make me pick which can one was better over another - you just can't make me! Go to ALO  pick for yourself!

aSBZ83yOX3SZeEsI2_OIbQ.text: Perfect place for breakfast.   Great service and good food.   The waffles and monte crispy waffle were excellent.   Sat outside and enjoyed the nice breeze.

lUWB8hmJaWPAuEAr507uuQ.text: I can see why this place has a high rating.  You feel bad not rating them high because they're cute, just obviously struggling.  It's a quaint little place with 2 people working.  This means service will be slow.  This also means they don't need much more than 2 people because there is nothing really to bring people in.  Their food looks like typical fare with a $2 "quaint" tax added to the price tag.  The coffee is interesting until you try it and it has nothing but sweetened flavored milk in it.  Seriously, don't get the large because you hardly taste any coffee in it.  This place is selling itself as a hidden gem, but really the only way it would work is if it's in a lesser known corner of the Desert Botanical Garden or something.

_CaHQV8HNEiTPvErR0_Etw.text: The food is delicious especially the signature French toast. However the place is hard to find they are not located at the address posted, they are off of Goldwater and Main Street

0aHsmABafYHanYmepRbhkg.text: Went there on Sunday 2/26 at noon. It was busy when we arrived. I am in the business (40+ years) so i could tell they were frazzled and behind but we heard good things so we decided to stick around. Spring training had just started so I am not sure if they were prepared. Seats about 24 inside and maybe 30 outside. Got our waters immediately but that was the last of the service. Took 15 minutes to get a coffee order and our food order, 10 more minutes to get my coffee served in a paper coffee cup because the dishwasher couldnt keep up? They gave the person sitting next to me a cup later but never offered us one. Had to ask to have my wifes water filled and they ignored mine which was 1/4 of the way filled and right next to hers. Took a total of 45 minutes to get the breakfast served. On the back of the menu it says their food is all scratch and takes time to make. It was an omelette, not sure how many pre made omelettes there are in the world. My wife had a monte cristo, bread, turkey, ham and cheese basically. They did say thanks for your patience when setting the plates down. Don't mine waiting but the omellete was luke warm and looked like a de-flated football. Poorly assembled, hastily made and flat as a pancake. Again, good food would have turned this experience around,  oh and the rye toast was 1/3rd of the way toasted. So untoasted, the butter on it didnt melt. No offer for a refill on coffee, no water refill wthout flagging someone down. Too much touching of the hair and no hand washing. Tables washed down with same towel they were using to clean the coffee counter as it was stained with coffee (literally, the whole towel). Our server was apologetic and friendly enough but just not a good experience for 31$, two entrees and one coffee.  Sorry folks, avoid this on a busy day. They also took the kitchen garbage out of the bag to empty it by carrying it through the dining room instead of just taking the whole can out. Kind of disgusting.  Service was a zero, food was a 2. My wifes sandwich was very good and her potatoes were also cooked to her specs.

SZPLQxs3b8J16b94DvRsSw.text: My husband ate here on a business trip. Not only was he impressed with the quality of the food and baked goods, but the service was over the top. he called for and was given directions. While en route, the phone rang and it was the owner making sure the directions were clear. Wow! And then when he arrived he was greeted warmly by name.  the French toast was an old-world bread recipe with raisins - outstanding!

jL9zfWshq6GDqtEYLXoz_A.text: Not sure what to make of this place.  I really want to like it.  It's close to my office, the setting is pleasant and relaxed, and the staff is friendly.  But the food is just too hit or miss.  I recently had their Jamaican Curried Rice, which sounded amazing on the menu with onions, peppers, and your choice of protein, but turned out to be a one note bowl of bright yellow soupy rice (my lunch companion felt so bad about my poor choice that he offered me half of his sandwich, which looked good...I declined, and went down with the ship).  Their Reuben, on the other hand, is tasty, if a little on the small side.  The worst thing about Alo is the beverage selection.  I'd probably grab lunch there much more often, given its proximity to my office, but there's just nothing I want to drink with my meal.   Virtually no recognizable beverage selections, like lemonade or conventional sodas.  Instead, the soda selection is a house of horrors, from celery flavored soda to what I had yesterday, which tasted almost exactly like bubble gum.  A bad menu move, and it keeps me away.  Overall, they have some work to do.

AYepuQMVnK7saWQm3uXg0g.text: I was in Scottsdale with my family for a day and I stumbled across this place on Yelp because of the great reviews on here. This place is a cozy little spot that can be hard to find if you are not looking closely, but it is very worth it. They have different options from around the world, as well as the American classics. I got the eggs, potatoes and toast, while my parents got the french toast. We were extremely impressed! Everything was excellent about this place, from the owner to the staff. I will definitely be back here again when I'm in Scottsdale. *****

7BJ0FxF3IdAt3HC5RicgFA.text: Good food, not expensive, and it wasn't crowded like most spots.

p4bs1D-R_dsKzcSvJ_565Q.text: In their defense we were recommended by my brother in law, who we generally agree on places we like. Place has a cute feel about it, but the service was unbelievable slow. We sat right next to the counter so multiple people on the wait staff could see us just sitting there, no food or drinks. We had to ask multiple times for things, food was alright, but by the time we got it we just wanted to get out of there.

W3S5iTG9jk7zN71dPMWQ9g.text: Marvelous atmosphere and great food.  Definitely recommend.

BIz6nmNLIHVLOLzJwoGxVQ.text: Very cool spot! The food was amazing and great prices. We appreciated the hospitality.

z7PAby6tuJ5obeIA4OW5sQ.text: Excellent coffee and muffins.  The rest looked very good too.  A little gem tucked away off the main street. Good choice if you are looking for an informal breakfast or lunch with some innovative thinking in the menu.

VxOpbgEAkBLDTkob_fUbig.text: Reading all the Yelp reviews made me want to try this place. The reviews were right . First, as we walked into the cafe, i felt as if I was at a small cafe in Logan, Ut or the Berkshires in Massachusetts. Definitely not Scottsdale,az! The cappucino I saw at the next table looked so delicious I ordered one. It was perfect.  More importantly for me, I had the best omelet I have ever had in Scottsdale. I'm from back east and am used to  the filings IN my omelette and cooked thoroughly. This one made my mouth water.  The only suggestion I would have is for a little faster service...or just learn to relax and know you'll be there for awhile.

0oHYCfPf3DMqTtRFNBiPsA.text: Very friendly service. Lots of global food choices- definitely ask about options to order something delicious. Family friendly also.

MWu4MZ26GB8r8NV4t4xQ9A.text: Very quaint and lovely location.  Breakfast omelet was unique and tasty.  Good value for the quality.  First time I had to choose between toast or potatoes with my breakfast though...which kept me from cheating on my diet, but I found it a little strange.

OTriGYCkus9MHYcNNjWDeA.text: Alo Cafe is excellent and wish I would have discovered it before! I had a turkey panini and was able to choose exactly what I wanted on it. The Cartel coffee was also great. I adore their patio, but it was a little too hot outside to enjoy it. I will be back here soon.

z7F9pYLVSRz58fKAsf32NQ.text: It was pretty tasty. Nothing stood out as outstanding, after having the omelet they cleared the plates, coffee service ended at that time (mind you this is only after 2 cups) which was poor service in my opinion.  I could understand if there was a need to turn a table, but there were 2 other patrons in the place. So not a busy time and the lack of service irked me a bit.

OMTqlgqw7Z3bmcegha0K9w.text: Food was absolutely amazing! So glad we stumbled on this little gem! Hubs got the corned beef hash and I got the huevos a madrid (with shrimp and salmon)... Absolutely delicious! Also got a warm welcome from who I assume is the owner. He had great recommendations on what to try. And drip coffee was an awesome locally sold bean. Definitely recommend!!

c92x4iFK04UITjfp6tR5Cg.text: Great food, real fresh and full of taste!

Dgs81CoeXKpKK8_XDKU7gw.text: Delicious almond milk lattes and the best hash I've ever had. Excellent and friendly service.

1AkadI2Su80p0oZ_LocDLg.text: Love the local, small business feel.  Coffee is great. Cute patio; feels like you are in your own backyard! We travel a bit and look for hidden gems like place.  Easy to miss since it's behind another business. Worth the search.. we couldn't find it,  so we called and they waved as we passed so we could find them. The Monte Cristo waffle is great! I ordered it because of another reviewer suggested and was not disappointed.  Husband had omlette with wonderfully seasoned potatoes.. with side of curry ketchup.  Yum.

EpkyKqU1_rjr_8P4R4Fl1A.text: I will preface this by saying that I am not really a breakfast person. I'm actually usually disappointed with many of the breakfasts and brunches I get. This place however is the exception. I had the Mediterranean omelet and it was seriously the BEST. They put a ton a feta cheese in it and the consistency of the egg itself was exquisite. My husband made his own omelet and agreed that it was one of the best omelets he's had. I was sad we couldn't return before our trip ended. We will definitely be going back!

Q5cquzXw7ei4d_tQ93zV4A.text: The Corned Beef Hash is a masterpiece!  Friendly service. Awesome patio surrounding their herb garden.

hdlLy5KBxNi-kyNb1Z0dsw.text: Alo Cafe is a friendly comfortable family owned restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale. My wife and I went there last week after we heard about it thru a friend. I ordered the Beef Brisket for lunch which was fantastic. I liked it so much, I almost ordered another one to go. My wife had a BLT which she liked as well. The service is good and very friendly.  The prices here are very reasonable and I noticed several patrons drinking coffee and reading their newspaper or computer as one would see in a coffee house. We really liked it and we plan to return soon. We have also recommended it to our friends.

UlTe-UeZbKd8jjCZNavTug.text: I dropped in for breakfast and a quiet place to study. Tucked away in a small brick cottage with a lovely flower covered patio I found Alo's. The coffee was strong, staff very polite. I had the Yucutan Omelet, packed with jumbo shrimp. Great roasted potatoes on the side. I felt welcome to stay as long as I wanted. I will definitely be back to try the newest menu items.

CB0adRAgDCHo1TQkf8J59g.text: Cute location, quaint patio. Service was VERY slow, not everything we ordered came, no refills were brought for tea or coffee and it wasn't even busy when we got there. Food was fine, nothing spectacular.

bHsHKlBeVENwQXc6CDG3iQ.text: In town for a baseball tournament and followed the reviews to this amazing place. The owner, Steve, came out and highlighted the menu with us, explaining the inspiration for the unique dishes.....A worldly collection dishes from around the world.  We all ordered different dishes and no one was disappointed. The Tuscany omelet featured smoked organic peppers, salami, and smoked mozzarella. ....incredible. The hash was devine. The pancakes are rich and flavorful. We are here for a week and I can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu. Wish I could give it 6 stars.

lDe2B3WNQOnBQrx1NlpqVA.text: This a nice additional to the Scottsdale food scene. The menu is "Global" and inspired. African, European, East Indian or just their take on good ole American food. The place is cozy, the food is excellent and the owners are friendly. Almost everything is made from scratch! Try it when in the area.

wOw4yPLGP2112ORzQV_tmQ.text: This was my first time there.  If you do not have a lot of time for lunch, go somewhere else. There was one server and one cook.  Restaurant had 4 diners.  Got there at 11:40, got my food at 12:25.  Had to be back to work at 12:30.  Food is very over priced for what you get.  Drinks prices are even worse.  If you thought Starbucks was high, you should see these prices.   I was very disappointed with my dining experience.

-b_wTVGn5JYqqT6nzGAUFA.text: Friendly and casual. Nice outdoor patio. Great homemade food at a good price. Will definitely return when we're back in town!

u-5E2JgxGPp5LlgMdiUVKA.text: Love this Cafe! It is in the middle of a little garden, small but great variety of delicious food from all over the world! Delicious smoothies and great coffee. Great for relaxed business meetings and to have a relaxing breakfast or lunch. Not the fastest service but it is a very relaxed atmosphere and everyone there is wonderful. I suggest sitting outside and enjoying the weather while you sip on a smoothie or coffee and wait for your Jamaican rice (my fav).

3l7c7hvWmF8YZLohBCUKnQ.text: Great place and atmosphere.  Been here twice and food is wonderful.  They comped our food on the last visit as it took a little while, but the wait was understandable given how busy it was and the fact they have a small kitchen.   Great place to relax, sit outside and enjoy the weather.

hu23qFmToLN7oawQrth8tA.text: What a wonderful hidden gem in old town scottsdale. Nick was a wonderful host and one of the owners. Great vibe and a relaxing meal. Waffle monte Cristo is a do not miss item. Can't wait for breakfast again!

eRMOrT4yVtIXdwujaDVeaQ.text: Best corned beef hash I've ever had, and I'm 43 and raised around delis. Everything was absolutely delicious.  Nothing needs condiments,  but they have a curry ketchup that is amazing.  The service is great, and the prices are almost unbelievably low for Scottsdale.

FBVVFB7e4XNNqD1xHthJKA.text: Best breakfast we have had so far on our trip in Arizona. Our family ordered the waffle Cristo, Monte Cristo, waffles with compote, and the Mediterranean omelette. Every dish was simply excellent! We will certainly come back here again.

ZWx4DH-TBRxR_YnVYXWBEw.text: This breakfast and lunch place is the best hidden spot in Old Town.  I love coming to breakfast here and sitting outside. The curry ketchup is awesome. Great privately own restaurant with amazing food and service.

dDxQ9rzBeRLm1j191qTJiQ.text: I love this place.  The food is excellent.  If you like spicy try the Chitown Heat omelette. Do not come if you're in a hurry. The place is small and the kitchen smaller.  I hate the reviews on here that complain about having to wait. Go in and relax!

tXaoop8vhBy9JwpV-n0-lQ.text: We went here before a spring training game to grab a late breakfast. After placing our orders, we waited over 45 minutes for our food. The wait staff never came back to check on us or offer any type of apology or explanation for the delay. Drinks were not refilled until we were able to catch someone's eye and request it. When we asked if our food would be much longer, we were told it would be right out...it wasn't. A member of our party had to go back in the restaurant (we were seated on the patio), and ask again about our food.  The food itself was okay, but the service made this a place I would never recommend!!

JqVHtXAKhN5NM2wYsC49TA.text: Found this place after reading the Yelp reviews.  It was nice, relaxed, and cozy.  I had pancakes that were amazing, so I didn't sample any of the about 100 hot sauces that they had available.  I will definitely be going back and taking more friends to this hidden treasure.

m97VGmuzARYQQrRax2eoRw.text: Awesome hidden cafe but very small.  The food was delicious! I had the krinkle French toast with the thickest homemade whipped cream! My wife had the omelet with potatoes and their curry ketchup. All of it was very good.  This is not a fancy place so show up in whatever attire you desire.

Y1lGveDR2aRXEjJZ5yyJ1w.text: Great breakfast and great coffee. Dog friendly patio! I've been here twice for breakfast on a Saturday/Sunday. The place can be busy and the servers seem a little flustered, but our food still came out quick. Will definitely be going back!

gyyFZAV39I_FaOUwslHWYw.text: What a great place!  Cozy and not at all pretentious, which is great in scottsdale. Very comfortable to sit, have breakfast, relax and read the news.  Great breakfast!  House made corned beef hash was outstanding. Very friendly owner.

rHGhrHEm18xdQjh2qBzQrA.text: I really enjoyed my experience at Alo, the coffee was excellent, I had the horchata latte, the seating was a little more crammed than I would have liked but it had a great small cafe atmosphere and friendly service,  I had the chi-town special and the flavors work really well together, the red chili sauce was excellent and not too spicy, a little pricey for breakfast but would def come back

H6zmgDyjJmmRjh1E-OSm_Q.text: Awesome little place. Seating was a bit iffy but expected for a cafe like this. Service was great. Didn't catch her name but she was very informative and genuinely nice.  Cappuccino was perfect, not bitter or overly sweet. It's harder than you think to get a good cup of cappuccino.   I would recommend the French toast with fruit compote on top. It's not flooded with sauce and doesn't even need syrup. That strawberry sauce was the best thing ever... It will turn you off syrup.   We got the regular monte cristo and the waffle cristo. I neglected to notice that the monte cristo was made with the same French toast so I had a double serving. It's okay, still good. The waffle cristo stood out because of the egg. Looked really good.   Service was fast and overall it's hard to find a complaint.

ewPvqSnolsLjIh-PvA-V8A.text: A delightful place. Small and limited menu, but a great patio and the found is quite good. Tucked away, I'm not sure if this business will sustain, but it deserves to. Try the eggs de Madrid. We asked for fruit instead of potatoes; it was very good. We will definitely have lunch here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AO-xov3BWZFe_2SD6qodFA.text: Went to this place for breakfast it was fantastic. We had chi-town omelet, an omelet cristo and a two eye plate. All was delicious !

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hp-7qMan5h8zdiv3HWz69A.text: This place is open and ready to rock!!  Charming little breakfast spots are always welcome and this is one of them.   I went on the sweeter side and rocked the Egg Nog French Toast (which the chef was thrilled I ordered!), a Pumpkin Butterscotch Muffin!, and a Chai tea.  damn...I'm such a future fattie.   But let's get real, this place is behind the new Cornish Pasty is a nifty little house with a great patio.    They will be seeing my face again.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo Cafe: Egg Nog French Toast!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo Cafe! Pumpkin and Butterscotch Muffin with a chai tea latte.
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

p_hSoMctdb6l-RL-krX7oA.text: Really cool place to come see but I found hair in my omelet and then our coffees took forever to arrive at our table and I think they just took the hair out of the omelet and brought the same one back. Because to initially make it, it took them 30 mins but to remake it, it was came back in 5   Anyway, nice place to see but never going again.

4TnftUsdMfyUvXxn2t-JkQ.text: Back in Scottsdale and wanted to try something new. Small place with a long wait for the food, about 40 minutes. What was really nice was that they tell you this when sitting you so you know and can adjust. For was very good and the Lattes where hot and brought out soon. All the food is fresh made and worth the wait. We will be back next time in town.

AtuxghXltSvQtTFisI94SQ.text: I went here to work remotely for the day, and it was perfect. Nice outdoor space, good music, friendly staff, and the best Cuban Sandwich I've ever had!

1WxF34Lm97pxDHNnefRxVg.text: Got the build my own omelette ($10) with potatoes. They have their house made "curry ketchup" which is delicious. Servers were very nice but a bit slow. Coffee was delicious.

6aJV0ITttoXJ9Vu76nkq-A.text: The waffle Cristo was 8/10 and the Sonoma chicken sandwich was 10/10   It's a small secluded place but so worth going to!

6uy33xY8BJyfjyuy-c3r1Q.text: Yummy little local bungalow.  The curry ketchup was really flavorful.  Had a lovely breakfast on their patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mozzarella, roasted red pepper, and salami omelet.

hVLde82ynlUKJxJgZY8bew.text: Unique little breakfast spot!!  Loved our meals which had so many different flavors.  We are already planning on coming back even though we live an hour away.

QMLr1FcDrI9aFSG_RJTC8g.text: Delicious food, friendly atmosphere. The  curry chicken sandwich was flavorful and filling!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Comprehensive hot sauce selection!

GaOUnujN1fCJXT8rEDsUiQ.text: Great little find in Scottsdale.  Definitely not one $ but food is worth every penny. Had the monte cristo waffle which was excellent!  Bf had an omelet that was the best omelet I have ever tasted.  All servers were awesome.  Great place, definitely recommend!

ZR5S7-WzNXTVOIelcWgmFg.text: Looking for a breakfast place in Scottsdale is a bit difficult because there are sooo many restaurants around old town. What attracted me initially were the reviews and photos and that this restaurant was advertising - it was the first to grab my attention on the page. Browsing through the photos and menu, I was convinced that this would be a winner. Came in and was greeted by the staff, once I said that this was my first time here, the server was so nice and explained a few cool things that are on the menu and that all speciality items are made in house! When I ordered the Belgian waffle with fruit compote, I did not regret my choice! It was soooo delicious and I also got the daily muffin which was the chocolate almond flavor and it was phenomenal. Their outdoor seating is great and perfect for a sunny day. Would definitely recommend this spot!

0Tj7enp_PHDl5VrUbeBWNQ.text: I only give this 3 stars because it's "nothing to write home about" but also nothing to complain about. The outside dining was very pleasant, the coffee and service was nice and one of the scones was nice. Not sure why one scone cost a dollar more - but there you go. A decent stop for a light breakfast for our family.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love this map in the bathroom!

DUuEAciQL86VgEGZtx8XwQ.text: My mom and I shared the caprese omelette with potatoes and a side of bacon. It was the best meal we have had on our vacation! We finally didn't leave plates full of food! We would de definitely come back to try the lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cutest patio seating

5HDJfkxAhNDbB1R2kc7dEA.text: My wife and I went to this place for breakfast on a Saturday while on vacation in Phoenix. We trusted the yelp 4 star rating unfortunately. First of all I cant comment on the food because we never got it. When we arrived the red headed girl told us to wait 5 minutes to be seated and the place was half empty. Another couple was standing there as well eventually she sat them and we decided to seat ourselves. The waitress was mostly concerned we sat at a two person table which she could have said 5 minutes ago but anyway that was far from the issue. After waiting about 20 minutes the red head took our order. Then we painfully watched as they were clearly cooking one order at a time. When the food finally arrived for the table next to us the man's food had a hair in it. At this point we had been there 45 minutes and still no food. We then asked the waitress for our check and our food to go. We waited another 15 minutes and the couple before us in line got their food. Of course the waitress had made a mistake and the order was wrong. All she did was stare at the guy because she probably knew it was 45 minutes to refire his food. We did not wait to see that outcome. We got up told our waitress we were leaving because it had been an hour for breakfast food. Id like to say she was shocked but she wasnt. I assume the food has to be amazing because otherwise this place would be gone by now. Worst service for a breakfast meal we have ever had.

O6mFU2VmhPxua33G6_sLvQ.text: Food was good.   Popular breakfast place....place was slammed.  Had to wait over an hour for our food.  Need to hire more cooking and waiting staff.

4cF8pQXCi3Ze5XCBRqgcpw.text: Get their French toasted encrusted with corn flakes topped with the hot fruit.. to die for! Very good food, also really good breakfast sandwiches

I6fyXzkSRzkcmzrxcTYSyQ.text: I would give Alo 4.5 stars, taking 1/2 off for lack of presentation, but it's not an option.   However, this tastes like a latte should. Next time in town, I'll go for some grub; what I saw looked delicious.

BlZNzqzGpXjTWlATjPO70w.text: Such delicious food. Stumbles upon Allo after spending the morning in the botanical gardens. I was slightly concerned about how they weren't crazy busy for a Sunday. I ordered the tortilla Espanola and it was probably the best that I've had since Madrid! Great wait staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla Espanola with a cup of fruit

EqrnYim9f7s4TYzPonZ0zQ.text: This place was kinda hidden, once you find it though it's quaint atmosphere and charm will be the first thing that stands out. The servers and hostesses are friendly bright and are always ready to give you a recommendation. The food is good, you can taste the homemade vibes and will most definitely order more than you can eat. The coffee and tea is also something to be taken with. I could see how this could be a locals favorite little spot.

1wlQOXgJk7PGtSPlXnQ7lg.text: Came around 11 AM on a Saturday and we got the last table outside.   Service is really quick and really nice. Our server recommended some awesome dishes. I ended up getting the caprese omelette because I wanted something lighter and it was amazing. The fresh mozzarella was on point.   I would love to go back and try the mushroom Marsala omelette, it's sounds amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Caprese omelette

a7LMoUwswty4fH8or8Z6cQ.text: Cute spot and great food. Ordered a basic breakfast plate: eggs, potatoes, and toast. Service was pretty slow, as far as having someone to take our order. Also, there were no utensils provided upon being seated when the server had just wiped down the table for us.

XjyKuXuQWXV_UrWQqLHErQ.text: Highly recommend this cafe. It's small and unassuming but the food is incredible. Everything comes out hot and fresh and the coffee is so good! I had the hatch Chile omelette and loved it. I normally wouldn't order an omelette with cream cheese but I went with the Estonian theme they provide and don't regret it at all. We also highly recommend the crunchy French toast if you've got a sweet tooth. Definitely give this place a try before you fall for one of the trendier breakfast spots in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corn flake French toast &amp; hatch Chile omelette

JSJAHsCH7l2vWzc8BtN4_g.text: I got a chance to stop the Alo Cafe today. Its a nice quaint place with a good vibe. I looked at their menu on Yelp and saw the a Monte Cristo sandwich, but in another picture was a Monte Cristo waffle? I had to try it! The staff was great. I sat shortly and ordered the Monte Cristo waffle and the South African breakfast sausage. Interesting. One of the waitresses told me the person at the next table was the owner. I asked him what inspired the South African sauasge? He explained how he had it on one of his many travels and how its made. Steve is a nice guy and his family was there celebrating a birthday today. When the Monte Cristo waffle came out; it tasted as good as it looked. I was advised to try the beef hash and it will definitely try it next time. To the whole staff, I thank you for a good breakfast and I'll be back. And thank you Steve for taking the time away to talk with me.  Peace and blessings to all.

oXhn6yoLII5W0V5aDADnKQ.text: Found this little gem hidden behind the Cornish Pasty Co. in Old Town Scottsdale.. Was very quaint and a tad busy. Server appeared a little overwhelmed at all the customers who were ordering as well as clearing tables in time for new customers waiting for tables to open. Once we finally got our table, out order was quick and coffee and water was brought to the table. The staff were very nice and helpful. Food was nice but pretty small servings (unfortunately) - however the flavours were very nice and their house made curry ketchup is just delicious. Great in their South African sausage links or patties - YUM! My wife had the hatch chili omelette - which had barely in spice too it - and she lives her hatch chili's.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo Alo, what do we &#39;ave &#39;ere guv?

F-V1N6shnoaWqeUTLGuvew.text: We were looking for a unique experience and came across this restaurant in an article. The pictures were inviting and the reviews were good. So, I took my partner for breakfast. She had a Monte Christo and I had an honey and herb omelet. Both meals were interesting and tasted good. Definitely unique which, was refreshing.   We also ordered 2 cappuccinos. We both didn't like our cappuccinos so, we ended up not drinking them and pushed them to the side (still paid for them). I probably could have spoke up and I'm sure they would have comped them but, since it was my partner's birthday, I went on with my day.   Overall, satisfied with the experience. Good customer service. Quaint place. Tight space, too small for large crowds unless you want to sit outdoors on the patio. The patio was very cute but, too hot at this time of the year.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8mfXKp74GU7_REOD5snlbA.text: This place is very small and almost looks like a house. My sandwich came out the wrong way the first time, they kindly remade it without any complaints. The sand which just was not anything special, I was fairly disappointed. There's much better places in old town that I would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8SqdxSpmf39md1NWlghz5A.text: Came with a 18 man group since we are here for a bachelor party and we all wanted brunch. The staff was extremely accommodating and very friendly as it is very difficult to take careful of that many people. Thank you for the great service   The food was tasty and unique. They blend cream cheese into their eggs to make it fluffy, horchata latte was unique and tasty. Overall a chill breakfast spot

WSSjahStvsMLbab9694pJQ.text: Good food, good outside seating. Coffee was strong and tasty. Service was very friendly and prompt. The building is a little tough to find as it sits back off the street. Definitely recommend going to Alo.

yI02D-Plg3rgjV9j3Bcb7w.text: I just wasn't a fan of my food or my families food. the ideas were right but the taste wasn't. It was just eh plain. I got the brie omelette. The coffee was pretty good though! Very full bodied. I liked the ambiance. The service was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tNilEdlUQryzK-IPO574pg.text: Tried this little hole in the wall for breakfast. The breakfast sandwich (added avocado) was lackluster with hard-ish bread. The breakfast potatoes were seasoned well but not cooked enough. Cappuccino was average. Service was great, we were immediately greeted. I noticed they had some fun floral teas after I ordered my cappuccino (darn). Sitting area is small and fills quickly. Needless to say I'm going back to try something else because this hidden place had a lot of foot traffic so it must have other better menu options and everyone deserves a second chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Traditional Cappuccino
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hidden treasure?
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

fjzvayU8EBtG8rDor3FqFQ.text: Outstanding food. Monte Cristo with house made blackberry jam is awesome. They have great french toast and the house made ketchup on the taters is off the chart. Top it off with a Havana Latte or Cappicuino are very good. Prices are fair. Quaint little local joint which I highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Havana Latte

USukOxs8qIs-kZKjWeNuwA.text: Wow!!! Best kept secret! I should have wrote this a while ago, I've now been 4 times and it is consistently good! We had the French toast with Frosted Flakes and the pesto omlet! The service is always welcoming and you feel right at home. Keep it up. And the curry ketchup is awesome!!!

wr-44CLwZSu2ZVD_H3KfJQ.text: In a world where good food has become easy to find, service earns a restaurant a five star rating! The menu here offers familiar choices with a twist. I had the Monte Cristo on their signature corn flake crusted French toast served with homemade jam and sour cream. My husband had the hatch chili omelette with potatoes and a 'life changing' curry ketchup. And the service was even more impressive than the food. Desiree greeted us and gave us a good amount of time to review the rather extensive menu; we never felt hurried. She went above and beyond to grant my husband's special request to get some to-go items from the restaurant next door.  Overall, one of the best experiences we had while on vacation in Scottsdale.

JwE88wzvRAVD92LHPTjwwQ.text: My husband and I tried this place randomly during the week to try something new. I'm pregnant and was craving pancakes and was a little disappointed that all they had was French toast and waffles...but let me tell you, it was the best decision ever. The French toast crunchy berries and syrup was to die for. We loved the little outside seating area, coffee, food and service. You definitely get great quality food that isn't like every other breakfast place. Loved it!

5Yo2m3Zajd0D1fs6J0oHZQ.text: I found this place through yelp  and I'm so happy I did. The food was very unique and it was located in a cute and quiet place tucked away. I really enjoy the silence as a enjoy my meal. The staff was very cool and funny. When you see the images it's speaks for itself. Great presentation and taste. It's also a great place if you want to work. They have outside seating under umbrellas.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0VqerdEonJ2WJXElnlTqhA.text: Phenomenal breakfast! We couldn't decide so ordered several items to share. So glad we did! Highly recommend the Alo French toast and caprese omelette.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

hD-cYKDzHFKHcUizItaXfw.text: A hidden gem hidden down an alley- that is well worth the search!! Felt like a neighborhood favorite. We had the sun dried tomato omelette- split between the two of us. Very accommodating for food restrictions. Staff was extremely warm , seemed like a local favorite.  We'll definitely come back!!

_s70-Tc3bYrKoETNgpfKFw.text: Hidden away a couple of blocks from Scottsdale, good breakfast menu and much less wait time. Both inside and outside seating. The outside patio view is the back of another building but good for a no hassle breakfast.

wwiGwlY1E-I1Fd8NXAwbeQ.text: Well, we walked in and the place was mostly empty but every table had a mess on them. So we waited for a table to be bussed and then waited 15 minutes for coffee then waited longer to order then other people showed up and got faster service and their food before us. Im sitting here now waiting to pay, 20 minutes gone by since the credit card hit the table....food was average, coffee was bad.  Oh, the other tables that got here after us all just left after getting great service!  Overall, come here to wait!  No, I wasn't in a rush but just wanted an average pace.

Q2enlLFND9xuGZndPw-1-Q.text: The corn flake French toast is no joke! So good! A must have when in the mood for the best French toast ever!

fLggm3Sj8VxlWQeYQDhpTA.text: Uncooked sausage I believe I paid for ...we came in before they opened to be fair they waited on us anyway but no potato's for breakfast for 1 hour we were told when they were opening in 20 minutes.
