I eaten there before and it was good, but this time I was disappointed. friendly staff very nice owner but the undercooked food ruined it.

Nj19Uz1qCBqUsuBJAfFd0Q.text: Excellent breakfast and a wonderful staff. The pastrami and eggs dish is fantastic and I will come back for it. It's a small cafe with charm and I not like a big chain restaurant. The owner even came out and talked to us.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8WKzeLzI39lDSPAd9WgCaQ.text: While the restaurant inside is small, they were able to accommodate our large group outside on their nice patio. This place is unassuming with its physical appearance but offers so much more with the friendly and patient staff, and the food. Thanks to the head chef for accommodating us and to our server for being so patient. Will be back again!

2PLY9WvYLWHpddydbhFHCw.text: Today I'm having the corn beef hash and the wife is having the alo French  toast and like always good service and great weather

3sk81dJmPGq4GNe4pLQ2jw.text: They have a great selection of coffees and teas. They also have a lot of other canned and bottled drinks.   The food is freshly prepared and is very good. I had a Belgian waffle and my daughter had the Monte Cristo. The monte Cristo was very nice. It wasn't deep fried so it wasn't as heavy. Tasted really good.   The atmosphere is nice and quaint.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5SqsPa8M7IF2NUtXLwqn_w.text: What an awesome find in Old Town Scottsdale! I love the ambience, the super-friendly staff, and amazing food.   We came for brunch, but I think this would be a great place for breakfast or lunch any day of the week.   I had the Waffle Cristo (out of this world combo of a waffle w/ turkey, ham, cheese, and an egg on top). My wife had the spinach omelette. Both were delicious!   So glad we found this place. The wait at the Breakfast Club was 40 min, so we looked on Yelp and found this cafe. But we almost ended up in the wrong place. This cafe is hidden behind the Cornish Pasty Co on 1st.   We'll definitely come back here the next time we're out for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Waffle Cristo! YUM!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Spinach Omelette. Awesome!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Waffle Cristo... YUM!

19mVGUf9BzpXmoPEItf1nA.text: The service was great. Everything is made there so it is all fresh. My only disappointment was that I ordered the waffle that was on the cover of their menu and, when it came out, the amount of fruit on it looked nothing like that on the menu. It tasted good, however.

tCqhIjfcXoInpq36ATe4nA.text: So. Delicious. A super cute spot with a beautiful patio. Everything here is made fresh to order, so it might take a second longer than the norm but it is so worth it. The lattes are incredible and I'm a bit of a latte snob. The owner/cook is very friendly and accommodating. I loved that both times I went the owner/cook came out and said hello! I took my family back the second time I went and every one of us loved our meals. A new favorite spot for us!

abQwqVVg6BC3d4DWgppRwQ.text: OMG what a gem of a place! The Kringle French toast is amazing. Staff and owner are very friendly and it was great to learn about the owner's background. Small place so I agree with other reviews about coming early.

kILMA6yT2k61gM650yOboA.text: Came in with my family for brunch to a please wait to be seated sign and waited for a while till I was able to get the attention of host in backroom.  Maybe they need a bell or something on the door that will help alert them people come in.   Other than that....the place is small and cozy. The chef is excellent.  All of our food were perfectly cooked and delicious.  We seemed to have good service after seated. I guess they jst need to be aware of entering customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half of my Monte Cristo.  It was yumm

W-Krp8WGUx0QzH8qqfTpWw.text: Alo cafe is a perfect little hidden gem!  We had the green chilie omelet and the croissant French toast and both were delicious! The green chilie has a New Mexico flavor. Perfect hidden brunch spot with a vintage cottage feel. Definitely plan to visit again!

vOIrXedUO697P5T-hLBUGw.text: Amazing meal...in town for a week and stopped here for breakfast because of the good Yelp reviews. Really happy we did! Homemade breakfast, wonderful curry ketchup for potatoes, and I'm not usually a fan of ketchup! Very fresh food. Waitress friendly without being overbearing. Good music, good vibe! We will be back!

raLuUq4fYNMoEZu4Bn0J_g.text: Absolutely fantastic. Very picky eaters came to this establishment and everything about this place is unbelievable, from the coffee, to the pastries, the meals and the staff! Very pleasant experience, you won't be disappointed.

Ub_wGexM3MoY-6gyj003HQ.text: Great atmosphere, perfect for a weekend morning. Not too crowded and the omelettes were delicious. It took a little while to get our food, but the waitress took one of our lattes off the bill because of the wait.

9ZE9fYVMbCdzinVCluzEUg.text: my favorite part about this restaurant was the drinks. both the horchata latte and chai latte were amazing. cute but small outside patio. a little hard to find, but definitely worth it.

twYSFeW_niKI4HIS_xNjxA.text: Cute, cozy, and yummy! So glad I saw this place on yelp.  The food is as good as it looks.

UDHit7jo82hv9yG1XbgqFw.text: We really enjoyed our visit here. The patio is great. Cold brew coffee is on point. We had the Marsala omelet, huevos de madrid, and hatch Chile omelet. If you like spicy, the hatch omelet has a jalapeno cream cheese that I would buy a case of. We will be back.

GnCJ2OduXc4TpchLrzNSxQ.text: This cute cafe is located behind Nance Construction if you're on 1st street. Walk along the parking lot between Cornish Pastry and look for the umbrellas on your left. It's fairly small, but there were tables to spare as early brunchers were clearing out around 12:30pm on a Saturday.  I got the Monte Cristo which was DELICIOUS. The french toast had a crunchy corn flake coating, and that textural difference was SO GOOD. It was very filling without being too heavy. It came with little sides of strawberry jam and sour cream, as well as some syrup. Everyone was super nice, the prices were super reasonable - I can't wait to be back!!!

bWvoYmTH1qigrIL4D_IXOA.text: More like a 3.5 stars, but had to go with 3. Had high hopes for Alo Cafe after all the good reviews but was left underwhelmed. The homemade almond poppyseed muffin was extremely dry and the breakfast sandwich was just ok. The Spanish tortilla was good though in need of salt. Romanesco sauce was great though. House made sausage and bacon were also on point too.  Service: 5 Ambiance: 3 Food: 3

dRMeq-l7oXqK8Ta8EN_hJQ.text: The place is small, cute and adorable with an outdoor patio. Perfect breakfast/brunch place in my mind. Amazing food. I can't say enough about the food. I'm sure anything you try will be worth it. Simply said even just the toast is perfect. Definitely try the jalapeno apricot jam!  Another important thing in my book is the service. The service here is right in line with everything else I've said about them, top notch. Desiree was our server and she was by far my favorite from all of my food experiences in Scottsdale. She is perfect! Great personality, recommendations and goes out of her way!  I will definitely make this a stop anytime visiting Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo Cafe

7DOTX4wOyP1OspytoINYFA.text: What a gem of a place! They had a great traditional breakfast selection but with a bunch of twists. I ordered the Chi-town heat omelet and added spinach with the Kringel bread (Estonian bread). My sister ordered the poutine omelet with English muffin. They have boutique teas that have specific purposes. I got the Fountain of Youth tea which reduces stress and balances sugar. I originally asked for jam with my bread, but it was unnecessary as the Kringel bread was a little sweet already with golden raisins and and almond crust top. Food was a good portion. You choose potatoes or bread for your side. Overall a great place to eat. Would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fountain of Youth Boutique Tea
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Baked goods
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Poutine Omelet with English muffin

kuIvhkjLhQ_xs4VxDlodsA.text: This place is so cute! Located on N. Goldwater Blvd tuck in the back of Cornish Pasty restaurant, but the food was delicious and the service was 5 stars!  I had the Spanish potato & onions tart with tomato sauce and it was delicious!  I will definitely come back for more, thank you Alo Cafe!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious breakfast
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cute cozy little breakfast place.

Zxk2DnctUx3k6pOLkZG9qw.text: This restaurant was very dainty and small. The staff were incredibly friendly and the service was great. There were so many choices on the menu for brekky and the waitress was very honest when we asked her what she recommended!! The food came out quickly, the coffee refills were constant and the French toast was delectable!! My friend had the burrito, which was full of flavour and a very large portion size. I definitely would return here for brekky in the future on vacay!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Alo Signature Corn Flake Crusted French Toast

ONzy_ax3SSm3QtEqaJBgUQ.text: This is a maximum great find. Wow. Possibly a renovated house. Amazing foods I'm seeing going to other customers. Dang, key lime pie is seasonal and not here now. So a plain waffle, 2 eggs medium and new to me, an Asian or African sausage she says is more spicy. Wow. Have requested a dark brown waffle as I like mine darker. Busy here today Sunday. Am not surprised given the foods I'm seeing. Waffle was good but nothing special. Sausage was excellent and worth a return for more.

WKtAglrCRJ0QukpesFnRoQ.text: I was a little nervous walking up to Alo Cafe. It's off of a side street in old town Scottsdale. It's a little building, almost shack like, and a patio. It wasn't particularly clean or well kept. The paint was peeling and the patio seats were old and dingy. But I trusted the Yelp reviews I read and decided to give it a try despite the odd first impression.   I'm so happy I did!! The food was amazing! I ordered a hot coffee and the Monte Cristo sandwich. Omg the sandwich was great! It's French toast with ham, turkey, and Swiss cheese. I'm not a huge French toast fan, but Alo's French toast is covered in delicious corn flakes. It gives it some texture! It's served with a jam and sour cream. I have never seen a Monte Cristo sandwich served with sour cream but it's a wonderful idea! I love sour cream! Also Alo has a million different hot sauce options! I tried several on my sandwich!   My friend ordered the burrito and Havana coffee! Of course I tried some of each and they were very tasty as well! Both the burrito and my Monte Cristo sandwich were huge! Both were around $12 each, making them an excellent value! I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Monte Cristo

tFJyMJ__v8kwZ8eGIWZp2w.text: For some reason i had a hard time finding this place on Google maps. It dropped me off in a neighborhood by what looked like apartment buildings... i had to look at the placement on the map to find it.  Cute little place. Nice to sit outside on the patio on such a beautiful day! I ordered the corned beef hash based on some of the other reviews.  It was good, different from what I'm used to, but good flavor. It was more of a patty than a hash, and there was some kind of herb and veggie bits... still it was flavorful and filling.  This is my first stop in Scottsdale as i got here early and my hotel room wasn't ready. Short walk from the Valley Ho hotel.

XRR_ZMR37TkVcGPZYOYMtQ.text: Small little cafe that packs a big punch of flavor in their breakfast foods!  I was in Az visiting and needed to find a little breakfast place, so turned to yelp and saw the reviews for this place and decided to give it a try!  Staff were friendly and service was fast! If you are in the area it is worth stopping by for a little breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

OJjGBBmov_VIX3SooLCdHQ.text: That was a good waffle cristo!  Surprised how delicious it was and if I lived in Phoenix, I'd be full and round from these things. The cornflake encrusted French toast was hella good too. Do people still use hella?

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Jokac_SeJKvM-cXemapM9A.text: Very unique menu and authentic European breads. Bridgette was a wonderful server, very attentive and knowledgeable. Highly recommend this little restaurant.  The pesto omelet was exceptional and we tried the mushroom Marsala omelet which  had unique flavors and was absolutely delicious!

9QXi7n8JEH7-soFeDvBgNg.text: This cute cafe is situated in the midst of other surrounding cafes and reminiscent of a little house with an open patio dining area. The Monte Cristo corn flake-crusted toast was good but the waffle Monte Cristo was even better. Both come with jam and syrup and contain melted cheese and turkey/ham inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Jd9LgeuEkc7kQPgEI_MHBA.text: Alo is an unassuming little cafe that serves the most interesting breakfast entrees.  Have a craving for shrimp with your eggs at 10am?  No problem.  Cant decide between an omelette or chicken marsala?  I say, why not have both!  Now you can, when you find yourself at Alo.  And just because the waitresses prolly never hear it before, when they arrive at your table, address them with an "Alo'ooooo, guvnah!" in your worst cockney accent.  It's totally precocious... or as I like to say "totes prekotes"

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. (Q.) What does an egg say when it&#39;s &#34;turnt&#34;?  (A.) Omelette! (Pronounced: I&#39;m lit)  This is... the Marsala omelette

3iCf1S8K9mr4EWjhETkrtQ.text: I had no idea this was even in my area. What the heck?  Situated back behind Brat Hause and that area, you'd never know it was there. WELL, it's great during high season because there are no stupid tourists (sorry tourists).  YOu can actually sit on the patio in the nice weather without having to wait for 2 days. ;)  Adorable, quaint and super chill.   I had the pastrami burritto.  First, it's HUGE. It was brunch and dinner, no joke.  Friend had the lox omelet.  I"m not a salmon in my eggs kinda gal, but she raved about it.  The service was a wee bit slow but very friendly.

9yobPlEjdDy-_bFeHloG_g.text: This place is total hole in the wall, in the best way. They have a few indoor tables but most of the seating is on a little patio. Nothing is over $15. Most of The food is Spanish themed, and there are so many unique dishes to choose from.   I got the poutine omelet with hibiscus tea. My friend got the burrito and a black tea.

hm3zSgyYvz7RDE3X4wsEUA.text: Cutest place ever in Old Town Scottsdale!! Found it by looking up Yelp reviews. Always love to try new places. My girlfriend and I thought we would give it a try early Saturday morning. Good thing we got there and got a good spot outside that had cover, as the morning went on it got sunny and hot!  Now for the service and food. I would give service a 4 but the food a 5! Our server was very knowledgeable and suggested what was popular and good to eat. As for follow up after food arrived and filling up drinks not a 5!  We ordered the monte cristo and the green chili omelette! Both were delicious! $28 meal tab for 2 breakfasts and a coffee, so not super cheap, but not outrageous for Old Town either!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hatch green chili omelette skipped side of potatoes and opted for English muffin instead
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Monte Cristo! Make sure to put jam on it as it was delicious
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside patio was so cute!

3tVr3h2Hq6a-nvG_zrSbNg.text: The food at Alo is eclectic and delicious! They have excellent corned beef hash and the tortilla espanola is so simple and perfect for breakfast or lunch. The beautiful outside patio feels like you are in your own backyard. Our waitress Desiree was welcoming and gracious! She took the time to answer our questions and was fast! I couldn't recommend this place enough.

eB-Ma-SPq02pTIZeddPwwg.text: Hands down my favorite place for breakfast.  I love my home cooking and it's hard for me to pay for something that I walk away from thinking I could have done better and at a tenth of the price but this place beat the odds.  From the ambience, to the staff, to the superb food I believe I've found home cooking away from home.    I recommend the Lox no Bagel omelette with sourdough bread.  The flavors that are consumed are a glorious experience.  If you have left over bread ask for the apricot jalapeno jelly...and you're welcome.  You'll be smiling the rest of the day.

vo8ERtBHkHLCN4VofdGyZQ.text: Everything at this place is top of the line. The owner/chef doesn't skimp on anything. He uses high quality ingredients for his food. After your meal you feel light and recharged, and that's the sign of a great meal.  P.s. They even serve great coffee, which is hard to find. Most places give crap! Great job guys! Keep up the great work!

X-2fQrCED0ovnC5bEjTzCg.text: My husband, daughter and I ate here after reading the yelp reviews. We live in Vegas and were traveling through with an overnight stay in Phoenix. This a great little place with a eclectic coffee house feel. The service was great, efficient and friendly. I had the corned beef and hash. The corned beef is brined there in the kitchen, potatoes were intricately seasoned. It was so tasty. My husband had the Huevos de Madrid and was very satisfied. He has an extremely picky palate, the shrimp was cooked perfectly and with the array of hot sauces you are sure to find a combination to please your taste buds. My daughter who is 4 had the pancakes with fruit compote. She ate most of her meal and left with a full tummy. The price is acceptable specially for the quality of food. We paid 38.00 for all of us to have breakfast plates and specialty drinks. The thing we most enjoyed is the enthusiasm the chef had for his  food and we could tell he took great pride in his job and that money can't buy. Thank you for a great experience.

QbM1Cdy8G8i9U5cwZZUMvw.text: Great food, good service. Great food selection on the menu, many breakfast and lunch creative dishes. The service was very friendly and tentative. Good to see some authentic Estonian dishes on the menu. The Kringle was as good as I have ever had.

VvkUHTuy2Mfc-pjfDSsXrw.text: 10/10. Fantastic food and the staff was extremely friendly. The pancakes were the fluffiest and most delicious I've ever had. They have Cartel coffee too! I'll be returning again and again. They are a little tricky to find, since they are tucked away behind the Cornish Pasty Co. but it's definitely worth the time to find the place.

ysk_Ov7--oIytoic4CYORQ.text: Best almond milk latte in Phoenix! This little hidden gem has yummy food, cartel coffee, and an amazing new barista. Almond milk lattes are my favorite but they can be kinda heavy. Since moving to PHX, I've tried them all over town and this one was the best I've had. The milk was steamed so perfectly, the foam was light and airy. Sad this place is so far from my house because otherwise I would come here everyday. Love the outdoor courtyard too and friendly service.

T3iyy3s-SUZ3zasap0wMxA.text: 09/29/2014:  I am a locale and went with a friend from NYC/North Jersey.  My friend was intrigued as they advertised homemade corned beef hash.  She said it was excellent.  I had th Omelet with Avocado and Shrimp topped with a Chipolte sauce that was amazing.  They also feature Coffee Cartel drip coffee which is a nice added touch to this little hidden away gem in Old Scottsdale.  If you want to have the "homemade" touch, this is the place to go.  It is small, so it can see where the wait may be long if there are many people, like on a Saturday or Sunday morning.  I had no wait issues, but I did go on a Monday morning after 8am.  There is nothing "fancy" about this place but it is quaint and laid back with great food!  I highly recommend you give this place a try.  You will not be disappointed with the food!!!

RfSif4qIeKJ2z_wXwo3h0w.text: WOW! The food here is incredible. I was absolutely amazed to how great the food tasted, as well as how comfortable and relaxed the atmosphere was. Will be going back and I definitely recommend.

75JMdnAfKQTZyF-yV3H8bA.text: got there early.  there were a few tables inside and a  few outside.  1 person working, and she looked frazzled.  waited a while til she came over.  finally another girl came in to work.  she took care of us.  they said they were short a cook, and were telling people they might want to go  elsewhere because it would be 40 minutes.  many people walked out.  i ordered the cinnamon raisin french toast, but got the kringle french toast.  it was very good.  my husband ordered a breakfast sandwhich that was supposed to be on a specialty roll. it came on an english muffin.  cute place, but seem ed very disorganized.

cmyIP_XdEe3tUWH-cgTIfg.text: Stopped by this place last weekend at 8am with my girlfriend.  There was only one other table of 3 when we arrived.   We ordered the special which was basically an omelet wrapped around some kielbasa and French Toast with a side of sausage.  We got our coffee quickly but no spoons a creamer with just enough liquid to cover the bottom and no sugar despite asking were precursors to the rest of the meal.  While we waited a couple of more small groups showed up and I scrounged utensils and sugar from other tables and we waited...and waited.  About 20 minutes later we got the special which was cool to the touch.  Thankfully she isn't too picky and made due.  I got french toast...cold...and covered in I think crumbled cornflakes with one link of sausage.  One link of sausage was an additional $2.50.  My meal was cold and the sausage was bright pink when cut into.  I'm an adventurous eater, but when the menu just says french toast I expect a classic rendition not someone's 'take' on it.  I would have ordered cereal if I wanted cornflakes.  We never got a refill of coffee nor our change from the $35 check.  My assumption is that much of our dissatisfaction was due to slow service and the menu lacking clarity.  The price seemed a tad higher than I would expect to pay for the meal even the food was exceptional.

k6LPuwfWsXi426MrTUc7Kw.text: Wow!! This is Old Town Scottsdale's best kept secret!!! My husband and I have driven past this little venue dozens of times and only by chance did we decided to stop on for a late breakfast, which they serve ALL day!! Upon entering you'll be greeted by friendly faces and an eccentric environment. The menu is simple and I'm sure the hosts will go into detail on all the different ingredients that they make and cook themselves. I got the Belgium waffle with hit fruit compote - so good! But be careful the compote was smoldering!! My husband got the pancakes with maple syrup, he loved it! The bacon was spot on, crunchy and delicious. And the eggs, while really over priced. But they were the best $4 eggs I've ever had!!! I highly recommend this place. It's pretty small though, so don't plan a big party!  I forgot up mention the chai tea! Get it!!! So yummy and milky!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Warning - fruit compote was HOT! Let it cool. So yummy!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The chai latte was milky and delish!!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pancakes w/ bacon &amp; potatoes - amazing! Belgium waffle w/ hot fruit compote was hot! Burnt my mouth, but so darn tasty!

O8gx4nQJEaCyisRHcWINsQ.text: I came early on Saturday so not many guest on this place, but the people who served me where very nice and the service was good ( maybe expect for waiting for the check ). its a lovely place in a hidden location and i think healthy food is important. i got the Mediterranean omelette which was very good and the coffee was also very good.   one of the best place in the area for breakfast i think

1Kz04iusr_bJzEngzqvQow.text: The food was amazing and the service was incredibly delightful! The corned beef hash was among the best I've had, my wife's caprisi omelet was top notch and my daughters waffle was also incredible. We sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful Arizona spring temps. Our server was incredibly accommodating and friendly. Can't wait to go back. Make sure you take time to find the little gem!

crlxY8t_-khJxBUZfbZlPg.text: Lovely meals were served to us this week outdoors.  We enjoyed tea and coffee served piping hot and fresh while we decided on our entrees.  The Croissant Cristo was great but the amount of sour cream and raspberry jelly served in teeny tiny plastic containers with little lids seemed so odd.  Could this be improved?  Both were inadequate serving sizes for the entire croissant.  Flavor and freshness of the meal was great.  The potatoes served with the omelet selected were flavorful and enjoyable.  The curry catsup is worth a try for additional flavor added to entrees.  Good value, great service and lovely food!  Thank you for the care put into our meal.

ax9ULLUboKNakUPCqrm4yA.text: I was in town for a wedding in Scottsdale, so I was looking for a place for breakfast on a Sunday morning. I looked up this place, and it seemed reasonable. When I walked in, it was a small cafe with about 8-10 tables and some patio seating. At first glance, it was a very homey and casual place with local flavor. The menu looked pretty good for all the choices, and I decided to go with green chili omelette with sausage and cream cheese folded in. Very hearty and meaty and a slight spice kick to keep the dish interesting. Coffee was great tasting and not very bitter.  I ordered a daily special chocolate chip brown butter scone and "rusk" to take home for the next morning. The scone was massive for what I expected, and it was tasty and flaky. The rusk is basically a very hard biscotti, and it would have been better with hot coffee. I would love to come back when I'm in town.

ry2MUcDiyhM-6mReaoprBg.text: Cute little place with a dog friendly patio!   Stopped in for breakfast with the poodles, and they were happy to greet all the guests and sniff the rosemary bushes. Okay back to the restaurant, here's the breakdown:   1.   Specialty French toast - cinnamon raisin: A+ 2.  Roasted tomato and feta omelette:  B+ (it needed a sauce of some sort on top)  3. Coffee:  Took a few minutes but it was fresh drip: A 4. Service: slow but very nice: B+ 6. Atmosphere: nothing fancy, but cozy and casual!: A   Overall, I definitely go back for breakfast,  there are few things that weren't "spot on" but it was a good experience and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/2 order cinnamon raisin french toast
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted tomato and feta omelette

BQh5zYxphUDY5TyFuf1A7w.text: What a sweet little place. I'm glad we went with the Yelp community's recommendation and stopped in at Alo Cafe before driving to New Mexico.   As other reviewers indicated, the wait time was a little long but the food was so good. We ordered the French toast and waffles, topped with real whipped cream and fresh strawberries. The French toast was perfection, crunchy on the outside with a custardy texture inside. The waffles (son didn't let me try them) smelled divine. I ordered an omelette with spinach, mushrooms and cheese with rosemary potatoes. Excellent and not greasy as some omelettes can be. I also ordered the house green chile on the side. Yes, it was $2.50 extra, but it was wonderful. The few tablespoons I had left I would have taken to go if we weren't on a road trip. My husband got the Huevos de Madrid with toast. I think he enjoyed it because there was only a sliver of bread crust left.  Our server was multi-tasking but did it in such a way that we didn't feel stressed or forgotten. She was attentive and apologetic of the wait time.  One last item to mention was the coffee. Nothing fancy, I just ordered coffee with milk and sugar. It's just the way I like it, strong but not bitter. Brilliant.   This little cafe is a treasure.

CDYpdWSUte67oDWqWruyRA.text: Fantastic meal.  Hole in wall...fantastic service...must try the potatoes cooked in Spanish olive oil and rosemary.... The omelet is fantastic.... Will be back again...

qGeq43zkxDIhL_u2zhn2Ig.text: Good little spot with great customer service, the staff is very friendly and personalize your experience here at Alos cafe. The restaurant is kind of hidden in a little parking lot but nice outdoor area to eat as well right in the front , down to earth cafe and great comfort food as well. Definitely worth a try

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Croissant toast and potatoes
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Soy Chai tea latte Is delicious

zilTrd5wp4XYlE_Cjfd0bA.text: Small little hole-in-the-wall breakfast place...  The food was fantastic and same with the service. Not much seating but had a great experience here!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-eK_tj11S5HGvmN5JwYLCQ.text: What a hidden gem in Scottsdale. There is nice outdoor patio and the breakfast menu is extensive and features so many different flavors. There is daily specials which right now being of the holiday variety. My favorite part of this place is the table of hot sauces. the staff is super friendly and warm.  I ordered the Monte Cristo with a side of bacon and alo juice. It is a traditional Monte Cristo but nestled in between two pieces of French toast. It was tasty and filling. Everything is fresh and local. Come find this treasure in old town.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A whole table of Hot Sauce this place is legit.

yDmA-22aY5Lr9wYmAqLX7A.text: I love coming to new cities and finding small hidden gems like the ALO Cafe!   Super cute atmosphere, surrounded by greenery, it makes you feel like you're on the California coast. Most the seating is outside in the shade. The staff was really friendly and the breakfast was delicious! I ordered the corn beef hash with eggs, not too spicy (I'm a wimp when it comes to spice) and the perfect amount of food. My friend had the omelette, and loved it.   Definitely add this to your breakfast list! For the atmosphere alone, it makes it a unique experience (go for the food too).

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enjoying my surroundings while having breakfast!

XvGW5Z8dlHrFKtbglbRNgA.text: 5 Stars for their service. Lattes 4 stars. Ordered poached eggs and they came out hard. Asked to get soft ones and they were prompt to replace them. The pesto omelette which was considered a special and it  came out looking great but lacked pesto flavor. Maybe pesto on top would be better than cooked in the eggs. I wanted to like this place a lot and they have the location & vibe on point but everything lacked flavor. First time there, maybe an off Saturday in the kitchen??

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pesto Omelette

FBIBCFdgTK6Og-23wW3Ylg.text: Inventive Breakfast options!  Went with Chi-town omlet.  Amazing! Great service great coffee.  Great secret spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JPHCh1M2zC5yOY5_kRjvBg.text: This is a very cozy little spot that we stopped in for breakfast while on vacation. Food was delicious. Service was great. On a Thursday morning around 9, it was quite tranquil. I had the smoky Tuscany omelette and loved it. GF had the corned beef hash and it was great too. Portions were ample but not ridiculous.

ahhD2T3IzvzeCrNRL-KzTw.text: I checked this place out while visiting Phoenix and reading all the great reviews yummy meal  and great service . I had there breakfast French toast with ham cheese sprinkled with honey a great combination they invited us back for a monthly dinner they have it was going to be paella dinner bring your own drinks wish I was going to be around one more day!

bgXnW7mg7Eom20Ult_bdFw.text: I got on Yelp this morning because I wanted to find a really good breakfast place and I picked this place due to having more stars than the rest.   I brought my laptop so I could get some work done and it was the perfect place for that. It has a really nice patio that I sat on, and it is a really nice day today so that's a plus.   The food came out just like I saw in the yelp pictures. My waffles had fruit and powder sugar on it, the eggs, sausage, and latte were all really good.   I've eaten at really nice breakfast places all over the US and this one was definitely one of the best.    The food was great and definitely worth 5 stars!

CSzdUMKzmztxjl4nUX_SRA.text: Excellent spot to chill, have a cup of coffee + brunch/lunch, & read a book.   I was visiting town and looking for a place to drink coffee and catch up on some work, and this was perfect. Easy parking, very friendly waitress, generally casual atmosphere. Kind of a strange location (looks like a house or dentist's office or something), but I will certainly be returning here again. Keep up the good work!

94g_UO2dq9ohW7boya4Qkg.text: Hands down one of the best experiences and breakfasts I've ever had. Auburn greeted us with a smile and service was great the entire morning. We met Mike the owner who clearly has a passion for fresh food paired in a way that is amazing! I had the Marsala mushroom omelet with crostini and my husband had the shrimp and salmon omelet. Clearly a gem. A short walk from Hotel Valley Ho.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp and salmon omelet with wheat toast.
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Marsala mushroom omelet with crostini. Amazing! Can tell it&#39;s so fresh.

m_QD9-XHk0-lWEmqsJst2A.text: Hmm not sure why the rating is so high. I came here for breakfast yesterday morning. I am not sure if they were short staffed but the food literally took over 30 mins to cook. I know this Indian family ended up canceling their order and stormed off.  Food wise I had an omelette with sausage , spinach , it was ok. My friend had the special the chi town. He said the taste was excellent.  The servers did the best they could to entertain customers but it just seems like they were slammed by 4 parties of 4 or less sitting down near the same town. Maybe they were down a line cook not sure . But I was super hungry wish I ate at the hotel instead

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Omelette

3SN2WCWwfydzheLT0yTpJw.text: Everything is made from scratch, made fresh to order and they have Cartel Coffee... they are the epitome a great local breakfast and lunch spot that you don't know about until you know about it. Such a hidden jewel!

jjVA5sX5hDc1LF7RXPa3lw.text: First impressions were that it was a quaint, out of the way little breakfast diner. After inquiring about the menu it turns out everything is pretty much a la carte.  I don't know how this place got rated a single $ but $7 for pancakes is not inexpensive. One of the biggest qualms I had was that they charged $1 for a glass of water. Not a bottle, a glass of water. After I finished it I dared to ask if they did free refills. Who charges for water???  The food was good. But nothing amazing. Definitely not worth the $35 we ended up spending. I think with a 5 star rating from numerous reviews I expected much more and it was a letdown. Upon looking at some of the reviews it seems like many came from people who had only 1-3 reviews so I wish I would've noticed that first.  All in all, not a $ but more a $$. And not a 5 star place at all.

vDhQTya7QQrt6FJ4r102_A.text: A nice treat in Scottsdale for us. Havana latte and waffle cristo are a perfect pair. The staff are friendly even when there is an ordering mix up.

vW50L7K7xB6oYZGjlGUTyg.text: Very friendly atmosphere and the owner was so bubbly and funny. She let us try the rusk and it was delicious. I got Huevos de Madrid and best eggs ever around the old town area.  I highly recommend this place :-) happy hunting

TIo1GE6LUsDpIkHb5b1UWw.text: Very cute spot! We loved sitting outdoors. The service was also very good. I ordered the Belgian waffle with the fruit compote on top, and it was great! We would definitely return.

kW4vt6DKaVQd95gLQJ7xmA.text: We had breakfast here and the food was amazing. They have a very friendly staff and they all work together as a team. We sat outside and it was quiet and secluded. They have a wonderful curry ketchup for the potatoes that you must try!

kjiJOQWSMcxsKn5wHE3okw.text: Great little breakfast place: good coffee and the pesto omelet was delicious. The patio was just perfect for a fall morning. We will definitely be back.

eXZJ88S4i0xe7jhaDVyn_g.text: After so many intriguing reviews we took visiting family to Alo. Our server was nice, but my order of the waffle cristo was disappointing. The waffle, covered in turkey, ham, egg, and Swiss cheese, was so over cooked it was burned black. This burned waffle brick required intensive cutting with a serrated blade.  The burned taste of the waffle overwhelmed the rest of the ingredients, and was unbearable to eat. What does it say about the operation of the kitchen that it would knowingly send out this charred disaster?  A lot, I think. The waitress saw my waffle, heard my complaint and whole heartily agreed. She said she would take care of it and took it back to the kitchen. She never came back and the cook, who I think was either the owner or manager, came out front but never said a word to us. We left in frustration. What does this say about the business?  Enough that I will not return.

ILDgvDGXtKY5xbRVbLSrfA.text: This place is fantastic. The outside patio is great for a Sunday brunch - I'm upset the hot summer is just around the corner.   I've been here twice now and each time the coffee was great, the food was delicious, and the service was welcoming. Definitely a hidden gem!

mz81-v2ST2xkTYQ0zgSLCw.text: Seems like a small restaurant as opposed to a traditional coffee shop Food - Had an iced tea (they didn't have lemonade for an Arnold Palmer) and key lime pie. Pretty standard Ambience - nice quaint restaurant, but not somewhere where I'd go sit to get some reading or work done Staff - Overall friendly I will note that I gave Alo 3 stars as a coffee shop; I can't say much about their food other than the people that I saw eating seemed to enjoy it

h3t5eCa_zfNeruSGEM6MqQ.text: Monte cristo is my main jam! Although the Cuban is equally as delicious! The service is always fantastic not to mention the atmosphere is beautiful and calming especially when nurturing a hangover! Beware! Of the hot sauces as there are May delicious types but then there are those that set your mouth ablaze! Nevertheless I recommend this joint to anyone that likes a low key tasty meal with a sweet atmosphere!

jmHPE6bzm2K0BpdDvJuvWg.text: Horchata Latte... Spot on. Need I say more. Pair with a Rusk, you have a proper motioning coffee sesh.

RQJqYTtGqWIHVzh4mf_SQA.text: I love Alo cafe! It is a hidden gem! It is quaint, cosy and the service is very good! The Belgium waffle with fruit compote is amazing! You must order the compote! Heavenly.

WWRAd8glhvh07Jed5ERUiA.text: Awesome, quaint atmosphere. Stopped in on a saturday morning and was helped right away. Got a breakfast sandwich and coffee. Staff was pleasant and helpful.

l1-ssQPqZKFTSSCQBblU9A.text: Great little cafe in a quiet relaxed location.  Very friendly service, good food and good coffee.  This is going to become a new favorite of ours.

ewozl6ClY8L7uSJkzBpliw.text: Enjoyed the food, service and conversation with owner Hilja and chef Michael. Will make it one of our "go to" places.

B3BEguW1DznbXYEYGwUgoA.text: THIS PLACE SUCKS! 1 star because I can't give it 0 stars. Total disappointment... I read fantastic reviews about Alo's Cafe on Yelp. And felt confident in bringing my future mother and father in law and my boyfriend here. Boy was I wrong! This place was pathetic. We got there at 9am, there were only 3 other tables of people when we got there. After a few minutes we were seated. We then sat, and sat and sat. We waited over 10 minutes for menus and another 20 minutes of waiting just to put our order in. Our food came after another 30 minutes and was mediocre at best. We had also ordered lattes that sadly did not show up until the end of our meal. I observed 3 dirty tables with dirty plates that sat uncleaned throughout the entire hour and a half that we were there. The staff were unprofessional and did not seem to have any clue as to what they were doing. Food, checks and drinks were being brought to the wrong tables. Then when we asked for our check we waited another 10 minutes and probably would have sat there longer waiting. Instead I went inside and asked if I could pay for the meal. I stood waiting for ANOTHER 10 minutes. Finally the man working gave me my check and asked me how everything was, to which I replied "It was okay." He then got very defensive saying "Is something wrong?!" And I replied no, because I didn't want to cause a scene. He then accusingly raised his voice attacking me again saying "Well if there's something wrong I want you to tell me!" I signed the receipt and left as fast as I possibly could. I could hear him yelling to me that they were understaffed and had people call in sick. But my god NEVER defend yourself to the customer. What a horrible experience, and a horrible waste of an hour and a half! Save yourself the heartache and the $70! This place SUCKS!

29sL_F4Iq6vAD_JVs6mkog.text: Great breakfast!  Had Huevos Espana and African sausage - very good.  I'd order both again.

bN4IFvt6Tn4Xshy1FB_Lsw.text: The best French Toast I've ever had, and I've  had them all. My husband had the chicken panini which was just as excellent. A quaint, cozy little cafe with warm, wonderful staff. Tucked away near old town you may need to look hard to find, but you won't be disappointed.

yQckQyGSM98E2qMkJIuTPw.text: Don't be fooled by the quaint patio into thinking this is someplace special.  Understaffed ( as other diners pointed out) meant wrong coffee made, no silverware before the meal arrived, food (omelet)  was warm, but toast was cold.  Went out of my way to try it and was disappointed.  Nice people, but I will dine elsewhere next time.

BhsZW955nFVoSLG8fRAXrQ.text: I mean, seriously, +10 for the service. It's totally earnest. I wouldn't say its overly prompt or efficient, but its hard to fault a guy who is trying so hard.   We went for breakfast.  I loved Alo because its adorable and it wasn't crowded with the Spring Training-already loaded-at-9AM-hipsters. Surely after getting such great reviews that will change, but that's the price of success I guess.   MY food was pretty forgettable, I had a breakfast sandwich, it just looked so sad and lonely on my plate. Pretty meh. But everyone else's breakfast looked amaze-balls and they scarfed it up. My breakfast sandwich was gone pretty fast too...it just wasn't anything to celebrate. Also, not at ALL a fan of that coffee. I drink a lot of coffee and I had no desire to have cup #2. But you know, coffee is pretty subjective...so let me know what you thought.   So if you go: skip the breakfast sandwich, do something else. And keep it a secret, because this place is tiny and the service can't get much more earnest.

_e6T3V6IJtNeZAl3JsNRWA.text: After a quick Yelp search me and my girlfriend decided on Alo for breakfast and it certainly did not disappoint. Tucked behind Cornish pasty in a small house with a patio, Alo provides great food and service. Our waitress was attentive and easy going, making for a relaxing morning meal. I ordered the French Toast with a fruit compote and I'm not sure if I'd ever order anything else because it was so delicious. After a couple bites this became one of my favorite breakfast meals I have enjoyed. My girlfriend ordered an omelet with bacon and avocado and that was also quite tasty. I highly recommend choosing this over the nearby Breakfast Club or other more known restaurants in Old Town.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French Toast w/fruit compote

THZs7Q3dYZteAzCoV9Iuog.text: Very little seating although an ok atmosphere. Sat for at least 30 minutes before a waitress even came and checked in. After we placed our order, at least 45 minutes before we got our meals (which I had to ask what the status of them was while once again no one was to be found). Food was good, nothing great.

Y-7VwWCWooe_8HWouRRnAg.text: Absolute worst service I have ever experienced! I have had bad service before, but this place wins hands down. More coffee? They won't even ask. Cream with your coffee? Why bother? They won't bring it out either... you have to go in and ask for it yourself. Food? Haven't even tried it, yet. Been waiting for french toast for about 40 minutes! Save yourself the trouble and do not come here.... there are plently of establishments that want your business.

lh1v9MVR2ua2nP-_BWBB0A.text: Love this little place ! Very relaxing and the food is yummy ! Love their curry chicken rice ! Get it every time I'm there even at breakfast time haha :p

FUga-NCii7ihfP8uFWq0dw.text: What a hidden gem!  Alo Cafe is tucked away, but it's worth searching out.  My Dad and I were the only guests when we were there. What a shame.  We took other Yelpers' advice and each got the Waffle Cristo.  Excellent.  The guy working was very kind, and the patio is perfect for people & dogs.  I hope more people give Alo Cafe a try. Enjoy!

u8Qa1uzvKrcPRatraPsLnw.text: Update review. We always come here for the amazing breakfast but lately the service hasn't been that good. It took forever to get my jam while the owner was outside talking. The food is made just average. Service is poor. It's sad to say that we probably won't be going back.

6ezvWvhdsHJ_ntW0gvDnTw.text: so so good!! i went here with 4 friends on a saturday morning and there was a table for us. I got a waffle and fruit. It was amazing and so was the coffee.

Q5nRuOoef8hva1YwNDPQIQ.text: The Alo Cafe is a small but stylish restaurant in downtown Scottsdale. The staff was very friendly and the food outstanding.  Mike Liddy, owner and chef, combines his first hand knowledge of east coast cuisine with his mid-western foodie experience.    The pesto omelette and pastrami burrito are just two examples of creative ideas that will bring you back for more.  Whether you're a native Arizonian or just visiting, the Alo Cafe is a must see.

Bk-wL_lnZuJwrA8IQUa5Hg.text: Located inside an old home, this breakfast/lunch place has tons of character (along with tons of hot sauce options) and a wonderful selection of unique omelettes.  Super friendly staff.  In the winter, when the weather is nice, there's also a lovely patio.

tb7edbm3z7GuzWYby7kgxQ.text: This restaurant/coffee shop is in a cute little house next to Cornish Pasty Co.  There are about six or seven tables in the whole place, they also have an outdoor patio.  You order at the counter and they bring your food to your table.  It is owned by an Estonian couple, when we were there the wife brought our food to us.  She was very friendly and told us her husband was the chef.  I ordered the french toast and it was very tasty, it had berries and strawberry sauce as well as a flaky crust sprinkled on top that made it very good.  The coffee is also very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. French Toast at Alo Cafe

ul-xNA_N_JzlyWg9YsJc9A.text: Really enjoyed my breakfast here this morning. Quick and friendly service with good food and great prices. Definitely will be back

Fy8xlylmBtCe7nwxBIr11g.text: Loved that it was hidden and the waffles are to die for, definitely recommend this place

J93e7DfpBydu5hDaks-ZKw.text: The food was fantastic and we would definitely go back again.  Steve did an excellent job explaining the specials; he visits several businesses to put together the ingredients for the entrees  Mike in the kitchen was amazing in the way he handled the orders on a Sunday morning. It was impressive how puts out orders with such speed.

uk6sq7DyABQpK3iv0OzrgQ.text: I just moved here from San Diego and came across this cute little cafe! It was a quite empty but it was early Thursday morning. Anywho, I had a latte, fruit cup, potatoes, eggs, sausage patty & croissant. I won't lie my eyes were bigger than my stomach proportions are well worth the price, so I didn't finish, but sure did take it with me. The potatoes were a little too salty for me, but I fucking love potatoes and fucking love ketchup so that fixed the problem real quick. I don't really eat eggs so I won't give me opinion on those, I guess they were ok. A croissant is a croissant, who fucks up a croissant? No one. The sausage patty was a little salty as well, kind of taste like the potatoes and sausage were cooked in the same pan, but I don't mind it because I do it all the time (; this place reminds me of me cooking at home or waking up at your aunts house and she cooks for you and your cousins lol it's cute & petite and the playlist is really nice! The reason I did not give 5 stars is because it wasn't to die for, but I left very satisfied.

7Z5kzAHnrrHPmGEaT0-_0w.text: My wife and I  stay in Scottsdale twice a year when we visit our grandchildren and always look for good breakfast places.  Sunday we found a gem at  Alo's.    Steve greets you standing next to the cash register as you order and guides you through the menu. Mike comes out to make sure how you want your eggs cooked.  Conversation ensues while you dine and what a  small world it becomes when my wife and Mike learned they went to the same school in N.J.  Steve and I talked about  out experiences visiting Argentina.  After eating  corn beef hash at two other breakfast   places, I found the one I really enjoyed that was actually ground instead of chopped  and cooked with a nice crunch topped with runny egg yokes.  My wife also enjoyed her Yuctan  omelet.  Very friendly and enjoyable.

fdG61fQcoyW223QOK6nuhA.text: Horrible service, horrible food. Your horrible breakfast experience completely ruined my weekend in phoenix. The waitress kept forgetting about out table. She told me she ran out of menus and that's why there was a 20 minute wait to even get a menu. She forgot about my tea, so by the time it came out it was way too strong since the rhe tea bag sat in it forever. My boyfriend's coffee was cold by the time she remembered to bring cream. And my french toast was under cooked with pieces of rubbery egg. It was gross.

axwO9jpXbDcSJrnKVAfh2w.text: Awesome service! and super friendly. It's such a wonderful little cafe. I love to come here and have a nice cup of coffee and relax. I like the variety in their menu. So I'd say, come in and support their business, it's such an awesome place to be.

qEISz6VvXMkNH8m2i7_cAw.text: My 5 star review is being changed to a 3 star for the mere amount of time it has taken for me to get food the last 2 times I've been here. I'm over it. The food is terrific but 50 minutes for one of their "signature dishes" and an omelet is ridiculous. I had the monte cristo and my friend had a green chile omelet. I feel like they may have gone to New Mexico to get the chiles. There were about 5 or 6 other tables that were outside and we were the only people inside so we expected a 25-30 minute wait, knowing that its a small kitchen. There was plenty of opportunity for our waiter to say something to us, but he just avoided our table. Total BS.

tESOFnclo7zvXlJoE_UPig.text: Was excited I finally try this place out.  Went inside and checked in and said we'd be sitting outside.  Cashier acknowledged and that was the last time we saw an employee of Alo.  Waited ten minutes outside and left.  We forgot something at our table and even went back, menus and everything were as we had left it.  It was moderately busy at the place, but definitely looked like they were overwhelmed.  Had high hopes for the place, hope they get it together in this very competitive market.

4-JH39B2WcVTATAfpCrJIA.text: Alo Cafe is in many ways an international destination, a hidden gem well worth finding in Old Town Scottsdale.  Steve, the owner, told us recently that he strives to provide "things you can't find anywhere else around here."   He succeeds in spades! Have a delectable breakfast sandwich on an Old Heidelberg roll. Or huevos de Madrid with shrimp and salmon in soft-folded eggs. Or something with a South African sausage! By the way, breakfast is served all day.   Travel the world with lunch if you like. Try tortilla Espanola, or a Milano vegetable wrap, or Jamaican curried rice, or fall back to something more domestic like Sabrett hot dogs from New  York, or Chicago Red Hots, or a Sonoma chicken sandwich.   Desserts are worth a look, even after breakfast! I tried the Kringle one morning, an Estonian dessert bread toasted and buttered just right. Now you try it! I also want to try Hilja's chocolate walnut pie. That could be an amazing breakfast dessert, too, doncha think?   Service is relaxed and smart. For example, Katie, our server on a number of occasions, is a cool, savvy lady. She gives great advice on food choices. She knows how to laugh. She doesn't rush you. And she just returned from an archeological dig in Israel! Remember what I said about an international destination in Old Town?   Hint on how to find Alo Cafe: Walk or drive around behind Cornish Pasty on Goldwater Boulevard and you're there! Parking is at Alo's front door by their cool, shaded patio. Bon voyage!

photos.caption: Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Enter here for an international foodie experience, or go Americano if you wish!
Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The cool, shaded patio is a place to linger.

U7bGsXdSt7m-xtN1eeafew.text: You must try this place. The food was fantastic - we both had the monte cristo and ate ALL of it. It was perfection just to sit in the patio, catch up with a friend, eat great food, and the wonderful service gave us the epitome of what brunch should be. I implore you to go.

Photo of Alo Cafe - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Monte cristo

C3HChEOMhTMOA3cm6jrjtA.text: This is a tough one.  Usually when I'm on the fence, between stars I tend to round up, and I especially try and do this for small businesses like Alo Cafe, but I just can't do that this time.   This is a cute little place. I've gone by it a few times & was curious to try it. A friend of mine had been a few times for breakfast and suggested we meet here. It's small with not a lot of seating, but it was a weekday so we didn't have to wait. It wasn't completely dead though, and the small amount of tables on the inside were all occupied (they have a cute little patio that actually looks like it has more seating than the inside, but it was overcast and drizzling when we were here).  Anyway, I'll just start with the food, because it's good. I had an omelette with potatoes. It was all pretty solid. They bring out this curry sauce that my friend who had been here before said was good with the potatoes, and she was right. They also have SEVERAL hot sauces to choose from it you're into that sort of thing. I like hot sauce on my eggs, but I'm not picky about what kind (I'm okay with plain old Tobasco), so when I asked our waitress if she could bring me a hot sauce I think she was a little taken aback about my "whatever" attitude about which one to bring me.  Here's the thing...the service here is slow. Very slow actually (and not very attentive). Luckily, the group of 4 I was with was not THAT bothered by this, but we were a little annoyed. It took us an hour to get our food (2 omelettes, waffle, french toast). Like I said, none of us were in a huge hurry, but waiting that long for breakfast is a little ridiculous (not to mention even when this place is full it's not that big so I don't know how they can get THAT backed up).  Even with the slow service, I'd be willing to be a little more forgiving if our waitress (who was very nice) would have been a little more attentive. After about 30 minutes of waiting I think she realized she needed to check on us a little more with coffee & water refills (prior to this she never came by). I'm okay with waiting when I'm not in a hurry, but at least come by and refill my coffee.  This place is cute, the food is good, but I'm not in a hurry to come back.

l1dTOZ1UdGqqvObro2afAw.text: Tiny without much seating but everything is freshly made on the spot. The flakes crusted French toast with ham and cheese on it is the BOMB! The seasonal hatch green chili omelet was delicious! Totally worth visiting and I will go back.

We shared two plates one Cubano and the second Spanish tortilla which you can't go wrong with either one. The curry ketchup is so good you can put it on anything. What a value and great service you can't make your own lunch for the price.  We will be back tomorrow.

nBsH4TsLzycy4lmZYDLOng.text: I definitely have to try this place again. The uniqueness of the menu and having good discussions with the owner make me want to love this place. The food was good. dY3lmeHZiZtoUYmgKcz7cA.text: Alo Cafe is a Yelp favorite that we had to try. It's in a nice, quiet side of Old Scottsdale tucked away from everyone.   The seating inside was tight but the patio outside had room for days. Since it was chilly we decided to sit inside.   The waitress was very friend and we placed our orders quickly.  My husband had the croissant French toast and I had the scrambled egg whites, potatoes and bacon with multigrain toast and mix berry jam on the side.    We waited 20 mins for our food. I thought it was a little long for simple breakfast food but at least the coffee was good.   Finally the breakfast had arrived and my eggs were yellow not white.... I summoned the waitress and she apologize immediately and gets me scrambled egg white quickly.   I wasn't overwhelmed by the breakfast it was OKAY!! I really wanted to love it like the other Yelpers  but it wasn't happening.   Look I love breakfast and when it tastes lack luster I feel cheated.  I do believe it wasn't the best day for Alo Cafe, so of course I'll give them another try!

tF8DvEn2djl3Vn6vD6Sngw.text: When you woke up and didn't know where you were, you wondered where you should go and eat. It was Arizona in the fall, yet you felt that you were in Florida, perhaps Miami somewhere, with all the palm trees and pools and green grass and all. Alo Cafe was not your choice but his. He did all the Yelp research and made the decision without you. In a sun dress you wandered out, using Google map as your guide. The place was busy, the garden patio, which he insisted on sitting in, was filled with early risers by 9:30 am, with only two tables remaining, both had full sun exposure.  You suggested to be indoor, but he insisted on the outside. You realized that you were dealing with a German. Like the time when you were in Heidelberg, Germany, when you were literately melting in the 96 degree weather, your German companions all insisted on sitting in the garden patio, it was the hottest day of the summer and they'd been freezing to death the whole summer.   What is up with Germans and their garden patio seating preference? You wondered as you reluctantly sat down, the sun was beaming happily down, waiting to give you a taste of Arizona or Heidelberg all over again.  Restaurant had international feel to it. You asked for the salmon and shrimp with eggs and potatoes, he settled with the basic eggs and sausage and toast. Sausage was South African. Eggs poached, like you'd see often in Europe, and like you'd order. He and you were two peas in the same pod, eating preference a solid 10 to 10 match.   The sun was migrating towards you, this time it's hitting you straight down, you felt a bit sweaty, at the moment, you wished there we some wind. You could never live in the desert, yet you were enjoying this meal, and this visit in the desert more than you could ever imagine. He insisted on switching seats, he's like that with you, always caring for you, putting your needs before his, making you feel that you were the most important person in the world. He was not affected by the heat, in fact, he downed even more coffee. You've known this man for 18 years, yet this was only the second breakfast you'd shared with him, the first one 17 years ago in Hayes Valley, a German restaurant, where you silently said goodbye to him, though he did not know it at the time.   From where you were sitting, you could see a white cat, licking her paws, and then she just sat there, her green marble eyes staring at you. You wished you knew what the cat was seeing, perhaps streams of sweat that was accumulating at the bottom of your feet. He asked the waitress what was happening in town. You stayed quietly. He's always in charge. With others, you were always the planner, the care taker, the decision maker. But not with him. He took on that role and in return, you could sit back and enjoy the meal. It was delicious. You ate all the eggs and salmon and shrimp, and then you worked on the potatoes. The coffee cups were refilled seamlessly. So did the ice water. Service was superb. The garden was getting more crowded as more people had joined in. The man sitting to the left of him spoke to him, "Hey, they switched our bills. I guess we both had Amex Platinum cards." It's that kind of crowd. Well to do vacationers and locals who loved this place.  This garden and the heat made you remember your recent visit in Heidelberg. Germany is a country you've visited more than any other places in the world, a place you were setting permanent roots in, a place you were now moving to. He was born in Stuttgart. He said when he was young, he would visit the castles in Germany with his grandma. You asked, "did you like the castle in Heidelberg?"

ELlC-cQJQxp1BeOT6cgO-g.text: I went here 2-3 months ago, on a hot summer day on my way to a lunch date with my husband and wanting to find a place that does take-out that had good food.  Googled it at a stop light and since this had good ratings on Google, decided to give it a try.  It's a quaint little place nestled in an obscure location.  I totally would have missed it had I not called and the person who answered told me how to get there.  It's a small place that serves Breakfast and Lunch.  The people working there were very nice.  Honestly, I don't remember what I got nor what I ordered for my husband, but they have normal breakfast and lunch stuff, with a twist and some element of South African food on the menu.  I do remember trying some South African sausage and it was delicious.  Will be back some time (most likely for take-out) when I go on another lunch date with my husband at his work.  Want to try more items on the menu and it might be a good place to take our teenagers to enjoy some non-chain food.  All in all, I had a great experience.

zFp4Yhi89pZG_ssg-8gTDQ.text: Discovered this gem just last week!  Tucked back off the street you'd easily miss it if you weren't looking for the place.   Very friendly owner and cook who was quick to greet us and talk about the history of the menu and cafe. Was impressed by the variety in the menu and tastiness of my omelet and potatoes. The group I came with echoed my sentiments.   We were the first group in the door that morning so it didn't surprise me that our food came out so fast. Would like to see their speed in the future when the place is busier. Otherwise, highly recommend this cafe and plan on becoming a regular!

BBftzx0rtP1X-Kh_NwNafA.text: Silence the conversation about the Valley's best hangover breakfast.  If I can only get it on Saturday or Sunday, if I have to wait an hour, or if it's not served after 11 a.m., it's not "the best."  Finally, I can find salvation in my hour of need... which happened to be at 1 p.m. on a Tuesday. NO, I don't wan't to talk about it. Anyway, back to salvation: Alo's Waffle Cristo. Start with a waffle + ham + turkey (or just twice the ham if you're awesome) + swiss cheese + egg. Top it with berry jam + sour cream + maple syrup.   Seven days a week, until 3 p.m., you too, can be absolved of your sins by the (Jesus H.) Waffle Cristo.

KfUeqUFiS9NBUV3pjxVUBw.text: This place has the best French toast. I also messed up my order to go one time, and they replaced it free of charge, the staff is awesome. I'd definitely recommend trying this place for breakfast sometime.

There's a few tables outside right under some trees, and the entire patio is surrounded by flowers and a grape vine overhang. It's quiet, and transports you to somewhere out in the countryside. I recommend asking the chef to press the sicilian panini!

MlV5cca9yA61wJffohVvQA.text: Definitely don't come here if in a hurry.  Three of us sat for 10 minutes before a server even acknowledged us and waited another 10 minutes to get the coffee we ordered.  Actually watched a customer get up and start clearing tables to help out.   The people who were seated right before us were still waiting for their food when we left.  Really a shame because the food is actually good but the two or three people who work here are totally clueless.

Q-s8ETRg2g_UnjWoJhhg8g.text: Came here based off the 4 1/2 star rating. It started off well. Walked in and the place was empty. Was promptly greeted, seated, and served coffee. Ordered the Monte Cristo waffle. My food was just ok. The waffle was really bland, needed some vanilla extract. Thing is, after I got my food, no one came to check up on me to see how it was. I literally waited 15 minutes before I go up to the register with my coffee cup in hand for a refill. That's when a new waitress named Rachel appears and saves the day. I told her my gripes. She apologizes for my experience thus far and accepts positive criticism about the food. Service was amazing from here on out. She saved this place from a one star review, and I will definitely come back to give this place another chance. I just can't justify more than three stars on this occasion.

j9D2CwqZOaSl_cZhPdl7nw.text: Little spot with very little on the menu. Lemonade tasted liked it was spiked with alcohol which isnt a bad thing but for breakfast yes it is. The omelette was good. Potatoes way over cooked. French toast  had corn flakes on top. Never seen that before. Waitress was pleasant though.

-D8Aai9VkFxRxNvhTx8dWw.text: Stopped in for a late breakfast on a weekday - we sat in the shade of their quaint patio & misters. It was a lovely place to feel like you weren't parked in the middle of Scottsdale with a predicted high of 107*. We ordered a iced horchata latte (best latte I've ever had. Ever!), the caprese omelette with potatoes and the Chi-heat omelette with green chili sauce. The flavor of everything was spot on - the potatoes and house made curry ketchup were insanely good. Everything was made with fresh/top notch ingredients. The only reason for less than 5 stars was because the omelettes were watery...which ran onto the toast = soggy toast.

fiZiK2s2_LwqSeUUyGbxkA.text: Tucked away in a little house is a wonderful cafe called Alo. The service is friendly the menu is inviting and the homemade curry catsup is fabulous! My husband had the corned beef hash and declared it the best he ever had. I had an omelette w the smoked mozzarella cheese and it was delicious ! Thank you Yelp for leading us here!!

VCBb4Lf5T3qrOVk5wAGH4Q.text: Hands-down THE best breakfast (and probably lunch, as they have the original Sabrett hot dog) place in Old Town.   I didn't eat one thing that was not homemade, from scratch, even my corn beef hash looked and tasted like that portion was made just for me (and I think it was).  Steve, the owner, and I wish I could remember the chef's name, are there and more than helpful to tell you where the recipes came from (from NYC where steve was born and raised to Africa and many other parts of the world), what they have in the works for new items, etc. The coffee is Cartel, the bakery items/food is homemade & they have Sabretts;  Not much else to say.  If you want to impress with breakfast, this is the only place to go.  Glad I just moved to the neighborhood.

4ZETfp0RpBM5OSX7KHIIRQ.text: First time here and it was my hubby's birthday so I wanted something out of the ordinary. Alo's Cafe was the perfect spot! This quaint cafe features a diverse menu with many of the sauces and jams house made. I love their strawberry jam--not overly sweet! Alo's make a mean cup of java and has a broad selection of teas and coffee drinks to choose from. Highly recommend the "make-your-own omelette"! Nice patio area but too hot outside for my liking, although they do have misters. Indoor seating is limited but fine for groups of two to four people. Downside: water tastes like tap water and the ice melted before it was delivered. Wait staff very friendly and helpful in their recommendations.

iW1nOqA6ABzb79RAZMwCYQ.text: Excellent and friendly service, delicious breakfast sandwich and perfect chai latte. What a gem to come across while traveling for work!

ASHggEB_LmiG0Y5UI9-JVQ.text: Excellent patio brunch experience!  The service was great and location in tranquil environment.  South African sausage was Tastee and the ChiTown omelette perfectly spicy!  MUST try the delicious waffles with fresh fruit.  Great find

Y29D3kfzNxJ6Ksy1izXJdA.text: Simply my favorite place in old town for breakfast and lunch. Small local eatery with outdoor seating but it's the food that makes this place. Chi town omelette is worth the trip from anywhere. Been coming her for 18 months and even though I have moved away anytime I'm in the area this is where I go.

dkaANak_4HJ88bU-T3DKhQ.text: My mom and I were needing some afternoon caffeine so we walked into the cafe without realizing the cafe was already closed (whoops).  The owner was awesome though and still made us two iced coffees. He was nothing but kind and helpful. We were extremely thankful!! The iced coffee was exactly what I needed too, strong and refreshing. We enjoyed it on the beautiful courtyard.

CCmHoQlVYfzw8TQJuaRNFQ.text: Cute place, but service and food fell completely short!    First, the positives: great pet friendly patio and a tucked away location in Old Town Scottsdale.    The negatives: we waited nearly an hour for our breakfast to be served (scrambled eggs, toast etc....nothing time intensive), the service was haphazard, my eggs were not cooked to order (I asked for sunny side up, but the yolks came out hard...disappointing after waiting nearly an hour), and my husband found hair on his sausage.  Apparently, the normal cook was out of town for the weekend and the service and quality of food suffered because of it.  I am hoping this was the exception and not the normal experience at Alo Cafe because I really wanted to like this place!

Mtj941I0gZX5v9My6y9QwQ.text: Ryan, who I think is the owner, was extremely nice.  This place is amazing with great food, amazing service, and a fantastic atmosphere!!

Eo5AOJIzCI7XZ_7JvM6GcA.text: Very tiny spot tucked away, but a pretty good find once you're there.  The Hubs and I had some time to kill on a Saturday morning, so we popped into Alo since it was near an appointment.  There wasn't too many people there, but I can imagine if there was it would feel like a tight fit.  The service was friendly, quick, and helpful.  First off the good, the corned beef hash is amazing.  It was cooked just the way I like it... crispy and soft inside.  There was eggs on the side, and they were cooked to our specifications.  The english muffin it came with was perfect.  Not sure if it was homemade, but it tasted great.  Now for the bad... we got a muffin as well and it was cold and so dense.  Not my fav.  Also, the coffee was so bitter, I could hardly drink any and the half and half curdled in it.  In all fairness, we didn't share our dissatisfaction with the waitress.  She may have corrected these issues, but it really wasn't worth the bother.  I'd say give Alo a try.  It's awesome to support a local business and trust me, the corned beef hash is worth everything else!

SrMfF5e535BFMCgbwlenuQ.text: If you're looking for an intimate brunch spot in old town Scottsdale, give this a try. Tucked back off the streets, this is a cute place with some great craft food. I got the French toast with a side of the homemade sausage. Both were excellent. A friend got the tortilla espanola which was delicious. The waiter was extremely helpful with his recommendations and service. I'll be returning.

4JvoeM24jzdgl4ptYsNsZw.text: What an incredible find while visiting Scottsdale! We loved it so much that we ate there twice during our 2 day visit. The curried chicken croissant sandwich, the corn-flake battered french toast, the homemade cole slaw, and super friendly and easy-going staff were amazing. Beautiful and serene patio seating. We even had the chance talk to the owner, Steve, who has created such a unique menu reflecting his inspirations from his extensive travels and family background. The perfect breakfast and/or lunch spot.

UQB2MsqVruICQQ27RkK4KA.text: Hubby and I went here twice, on two separate occasions. The first time, we found it on Yelp. We sought it out again this past weekend. We had great service in a wonderful setting. Both times we had these awesome, fresh, healthy omelets. They even make a couple different types with seafood in them. The servers bring out homemade curry ketchup and encourage patrons to try it on their potatoes. It is surprisingly good! Their coffee drinks are top-notch too.

A4q4ebWZyQ887aPK7jbWMw.text: Maybe one of my favorite breakfast places anywhere. Inventive omelet / egg menu (as inventive as one can get with eggs). Charming low key atmosphere off the main drag near Old Scottsdale. Nothing fancy, e.g. No Eggs Benedict.  But the coffee is dark and hot and yummy, the service is friendly. And I get the sense that food is cooked like I make at home -with care- not slopped out by a short order cook in a hurry.

XDmxP9dPFJmv4fs5NEq8Gw.text: Love this place. Hidden, never crowded, excellent food and service. Great coffee, cristos and hash.

Ysns7c4Di9YZH5ZkFXycCw.text: Fantastic homemade corned beef hash .. Huge hot sauce collection, loved the curry ketchup too. So good I returned the next day for breakfast.

f90i7TY5-hRrI0MZqsdm4A.text: Came for the first time today. Cute little cafe tucked behind the madness of downtown Scottsdale. The wait staff was very kind and attentive and food came out quick! We came at about noon on a Sunday and there was almost no one here. Had to try that Waffle Monte Cristo I've heard so much about and I was NOT disappointed! Id definitely recommend this place.

jWIuQhemxs7wiWGSvSJF8Q.text: Came here for the first time today and loved it! Very small and homey with cute interior! All the workers were nice and welcoming and served us right away! I got an iced caramel latte which was delicious! The pancakes, omelet, and breakfast sandwich were delightful! Such a good environment and good food/coffee! Will be coming back for sure(:
