qF1pFUaH2fZ4pynb8zriqA.text: This breakfast place was tucked in the corner in scottsdale. My boyfriend and I ended up coming here completely by accident. We were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere, especially being in scottsdale. Scottsdale restaurants are sometimes "stuck up" and that makes us feel uncomfortable. Anyway, I had a white chocolate mocha and the waffle cristo. OH MY. Delicious. It was savory and sweet. Our waitress was also amazing! The only reason for the 4 star was because my boyfriends coffee was sour. Otherwise, everything was perfect and we'll probably be back.

TCsw5CcWtn9nYnVy9TJksg.text: I was visiting the area with my family for New Years and we came across this little hole in the wall breakfast place in Scottsdale. Per other yelp reviews, we ordered the Waffle Cristo to share. It was so different and delicious. The jam seems a little weird to put on it at first, but it definitely works. I would definitely recommend at least trying the Waffle Cristo once! My mom ordered the omelet special that had cream cheese and green chills with chipotle cream and she loved it. I had a chai tea latte which was perfect. If I'm ever back in Scottsdale I will be back!

yRE0wTI_eqDowYAS_V39rw.text: I can never eat Belgian waffles anywhere else. They were so light and the perfect consistency.  I built my own omelette- smoked mozzarella cheese, onion, spinach and HOMEMADE sausage. They also make a hatch green chili sauce that is extra $$ but a MUST and totally worth it. Talked to the owner who has a vast knowledge of worldwide cuisine and his love of food is clearly conveyed in every dish.  Can't wait to go back and try the monte cristo.

KwlV7gDPnrxSd_X8qoL2nA.text: I keep trying to like this place! It's in my neighborhood and soo cute but every time I go, just bad service. I gave it three chances and each time i was overlooked or waited a long time to get acknowledged by the waitstaff.

_mQd5C3e_1Uf66Q0SjMw8w.text: This is not the first time that I've been here but the first time that I've written a review. I just can't keep it to myself anymore this place is great get the waffles Christo. Did I mention that I love waffles?

LOXbpmSdM6p1IG5tLi7Hqg.text: This little quaint cafe is perfect. It's quiet and personable. I've only had the breakfast, but everything was perfect.

FPm2teKr4snb_KE3SBb7Cw.text: What a fun little spot off the beaten path in Old Town Scottsdale. After a semi-crazy night in Scottsdale, we hit up Yelp for a new place to have breakfast. There's a lot of great competition in Scottsdale, and Alo stands right at the top with the best. Friendly service, tasty food made with genuine creativity and fairly priced.

bQEjUSj4DXh7jQ9dlehzVQ.text: The BF and I decided to try out something new and came across this little gem hidden in the middle of Old Town Scottsdale. This cafe is very small but offers a large variety of drinks and food. There is limited indoor an outdoor seating but we had no trouble being seated and didn't have to wait. We tried the Mediterranean Omelette and the Huevos De Madrid egg dish and both of them were delicious and filling! They came with a choice of bread and two different unique types of jelly that came on the side. Our server was very friendly, attentive and met all of our needs. The corned beef hash was highly recommended to us and we plan on trying that on our next visit along with the NY Sabrett Hot Dog, which I haven't seen on a menu outside of NY.

dBkJcrPLO7qx3-dxkNH2mw.text: Wonderful staff, very helpful and nice. The omelette was awesome (I had the chipotle sauce on it... Very good).  Overall a great experience, great food, and great staff. I will definitely be back!

oNpTUdnAqFVksn-ndnRBgg.text: What a great hidden gem.  The service and food was great. The corn beef hash was homemade and delicious. The Mediterranean omelet was awesome. It was moist and full of flavor. Coffee is made fresh for everyone.

gjtpekwNo3efr6PUDoIWbQ.text: I'm not sure if we caught them on an off day or if the other reviewers are suffering from some sort of mass delusion, but this was one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had. It took 30 minutes to get menus and coffee, we never got full place settings or basic condiments and the coffee tasted like dirt brewed through a dirty sock. Food was mediocre at best. Omelette was indeed 3 eggs, but they were quail eggs (ate it in 4 bites). Avoid this place if you have any dining standards whatsoever.

iLrCnCpjIzoZbCDkk7ggQg.text: Nice little place. Friendly owner and staff. Waffle with fruit compote was yummy.  Pretty outside sitting area. But was a little too cold today.

06NMy87PFXftoZfjbCQZPQ.text: Service is great and so is the breakfast.  The Belgian waffle with fruit is amaze-balls.  My server, Alicia was super friendly and quick to check on me and make sure I was enjoying my meal.  Get here early, because it gets super busy!
